ReviewTitle: This stuff is awesome, goes on clear
ReviewText: This is the lotion that my dermatologist gives out as samples... which speaks to the high quality! This stuff is awesome, goes on clear, sets a nice stage for make-up, and leaves zero oily residue. I use many topical and oral prescriptions to keep my face breakout free which in turn makes it very sensitive, and this product does not irritate my face at all! The only negative is that the product does have a slight "sunscreen smell", however it isn't super strong and definitely is worth it!
Misleading advertising. This is promoted as having non-chemical active ingredients and that is not true. Yes it has zinc oxide but it also contains octinoxate.

I have occational adult acne and this is the only facial sunscreen I use, it has zinc oxide, feels great, blocks the sun from my face all day, even with a daily run in there!  Never makes me break out, and every other sunscreen lotion I've tried in 35 years makes me break out either immediately or within a few days of use.I highly recommend this if you breakout, have sensitive skin and need a great daily sunscreen.  Because pimples and wrinkles are not hot!

ReviewTitle: This is my favorite face sunscreen
ReviewText: This is my favorite face sunscreen.  Esp for those of us like myself who have issues with rosacea/redness.  No irritation whatsoever.  I know others have reviewed that this seems to peel.....I've only seen that happen to me like 3 times.  The key for me is to not use a ton....which I know is kind of defeating the purpose.  But a single layer works great for me and I don't burn with this.  I used to buy from my derm office but the price here is better.
All day moisturize, unscented,  good moisturizer sunscreen. I’ll buy again.

I’ve sensitive skin/rosacea, ISO a sunscreen product that gave great sun protection, didn’t burn my skin or eyes. This product goes on smoothly (no stinging) and the end of day my dry/sensitive eyes feel like eyes not embers. Sl whitish cast from zinc, smooth non goopy application.

I have used this product regularly for several years, and my daughter now uses it also. In don't know what I'd do without it. When I first discovered it, I thought it was a revelation. Unlike other zinc sunscreens I notice almost no white cast, nor does it have the greasy feel common with all sunscreens, chemical or mineral, when used on the face--instead it feels just like a good moisturizer. I have not observed any skin problems while using this product. If it were not so expensive, I'd use it all over! I do often put some on the back of my hands.I just noticed some negative reviews, and wanted to add a comment. Everyone's body chemistry is different, and for any product out there, there are some people who are going to react to it. That is why you should spot test any product you are going to use on your face.  I also realize that some folks are concerned about the Octinoxate chemical sunscreen and the small size of the zinc particles. I'll admit these things are a tiny bit worrisome, but as with the question "what form of exercise?" the answer is "the one you'll do". If you want to protect your face from the sun, this is one you are likely to "do", not something heavy and clumping and white as the most "all natural" sunscreens tend to be. And hats and shade don't actually prevent as much UV from reaching your face as most people believe.

ReviewText: Incredible!  I'm a young, fashion forward person who works outside in the sun, and sweats while working.  I don't want to wrinkle or get skincancer, and I've tried a number of "sensitive skin" products.  None work like Elta MD.  I needed a sunscreen that doesn't burn when your pores open up from the heat.  It's light, it doesn't feel oily at all, and it doesn't burn.HIGHLY HIGHLY HIGHLY recommended.  I am now a loyal customer of this brand, and I have purchased this product multiple times.

This was not a brand new item but it is still being sold for the price of a new one, and they didn’t even bother removing the TESTER sticker.
This sunscreen spreads smoothly, dries clear, feels lightweight and leaves a nice finish on the skin and it does not sting our eyes. All and all great product.

ReviewTitle: Non greasy. No sign of irritation
ReviewText: I love this sunscreen. It is totally non greasy and neutral for my skin. It can make my face slightly whiter but it doesn't bother me. I just did an acid peeling and I NEED sunscreen. The only thing I am not quite satisfied with is that I have to apply a thick layer of it to make sure I won't leave any new skin under the sunlight. I believe, though, it can be used up pretty fast because of the amount of this product.

I have acne prone skin and was never a fan of putting anything extra on my face. Now that I am in my mid 30's and constantly under the Florida sun, I know I have to put on sunblock in order to preserve my skin. This is the best sunscreen I have ever used on my face. It's light and after a few minutes it feels like you have nothing on. It was recommended to my by an esthetician who was giving me facials, and then approved by my dermatologist. I highly recommend!

I do want to give this product a bit more time for me to evaluate its effectiveness over the summer when my freckles usually get dark, but I can evaluate it based on my skin's reaction to it after a few days of use. ReviewTitle: who else could be better at producing an amazing sunscreen
ReviewText: Elta MD is the only sunscreen I use. Some of them make me itch... Elta MD does not. Besides the sunscreen, there are other moisturizing ingredients. My dermatologist sells this as well. Plus... it's made in Arizona, who else could be better at producing an amazing sunscreen!

ReviewTitle: Best Sunscreen to Wear Under Makeup
ReviewText: This is one of my favorite daily sunscreens on the market.  It absorbs quickly without leaving a whitish cast so that makeup application on top of it is very easy.  I love that it also contains great anti-aging ingredients like niacinamide to help brighten my skin.  I am a long time user of Japanese sunscreens because they provide high SPF protection while absorbing quickly.  Elta MD offers the same protection but without the high alcohol content of some of the Japanese brands.  This is a great sunscreen for those who have combination skin and want a high SPF, all day protection.

After doing a lot of research for the best sunscreens for my malasma I choose this one and I love it.  No issues, no irritatation. I use on the weekends only when I'm at the beach. I use another brand for my daily use.

ReviewTitle: Excellent- better than neutrogena dry touch at keeping down acne
ReviewText: Pros:- great SPF coverage, tested on my melasma for the summer- it lasts (used it daily for at least 3 months and it's still going- cleared up my acne, even used under make-up- no white residue (neutrogena left white streaks and patches if I wasn't very careful)- I recommend to use it with a light moisturizer underneath and it still removes any shine- waaayy better than neutrogena dry touch sun blockCon:Can't tell how much is left in the bottleI have melasma and need full SPF coverage every day, even on cloudy days, to prevent dark patches on my face from forming. I used to use neutrogena dry touch SPF 80-100 daily for 11 years. I thought it was the only product out there that fit my needs. While it worked for keeping dark spots away, I continued to struggle with a shiny and acne prone complextion. So, I decided to search amazon reviews for something better. In on June 25, 2014 reviews led me to this sunscreen (Elta MD UV Clear). IT. IS. Awesome. I no longer have problems with shine, and my breakouts have been eliminated. Gone! Also, it does seem that my brown patches have improved, which is probably just the natural course of the melasma if it doesn't get more sun. I am writing this review just over 3 months later. I do also use a light moisturizer (oil of Olay daily moisturizer w SPF, which has need the same one for me for over a decade) under the EltaMD. A few days a go I tried using just the sunscreen alone, but found my skin was too dry. I'm not done with the botte yet, but I'm heading back to amazon today to buy another bottle just in case it runs out soon.

This sunscreen did nothing to protect my skin from burning. I am taking an antibiotic that makes me sunburn prone, & Blue Lizard Sensitive 30 worked wonders. Using the Elta  product offered no protection & I burned as if I hadn’t applied anything at all. Just missed my return window by two days, & disappointed that I’ll have to throw this money doesn’t down the drain.

I bought this product because I needed something with SPF to wear every day. I found out I am more prone to skin cancer as I carry the BRCA2 gene, and as I have fair skin I knew it was more important for me to jump on the SPF train sooner rather than later. After reading many reviews for different products I decided on the EltaMD. It is absorbed quickly into the skin, moisturizes my skin and doesn't contribute to oiliness. I have combination skin and it definitely helps where it needs to help and doesn't make it worse in my trouble spots. I also have acne due to PCOS and it has not broken me out. I can't say that it has helped, but my acne is more hormone related than anything topical I can do to the skin, but at the very least it is not breaking me out unnecessarily. I love that it absorbs and dries quickly on the skin and doesn't add much time onto my daily beauty routine. I intend on wearing it every day even though I'm not out in the sun very much - prevention is key!
This is the first sunscreen that did not cause a break-out for me. I have tried many supposedly hypoallergenic products but this is the only one that works

ReviewTitle: The best sunscreen For your face.
ReviewText: I will be the first to admit I never have taken care of my skin. On the other hand I also do not know how to wear makeup. A little eyeliner and I am out the door! I'm 28. Recently after I had my son I've noticed some pesky lines and spots so I've decided to start a skin care regimen. My regimen consists only of washing my face, applying moisturizer, and finally sunscreen. I have combination skin. Oily T-zone. During the winter a bit dry. Of course I get the occasional acne too. I've tried several facial sunscreens that are oil free and for acne prone skin. They all felt very heavy, left my face very shiny and even more oily. After reading reviews decided to give this a try. What I like is its in a pump. One little squirt does the trick so no waste. The color is a light cream color but rubs on clear. It feels so light weight on my skin and does not look shiny at all! I've only had it a few days but so far am so very impressed. I haven't had a breakout yet and I almost always do when trying new products. If you want a nice light weight, non greasy, non fragrant sunscreen this is what you need!

I have oily skin and have tried a lot of other sunscreens over the years. I either end up with breakouts, a pink nose and cheeks, or more freckles.....this sunscreen is light, yet has a high SPF. I use it every day and have purchased this three or four times so far.  I would recommend this sunscreen!  It's not your every day $8 sunscreen from a drug store. There are high quality ingredients in this sunscreen to account for the price.  And this sunscreen does not make my face burn either!
Love this sunscreen. A little hesitant ordering it from Amazon. It is the original product with expiration date and packaged well.
love this product for the sun

ReviewTitle: White porcelain to strawberry ice cream.
ReviewText: Unfortunately, this product made my face look like strawberry ice cream, and not in a good way. The effect was almost immediate and I used for almost two full weeks. Switched back to trusty Kiehl's (Ultra Facial Moisturizer with SPF, in case you were wondering).  I will be attempting a return.

One word. Fantastic!!. I'm a 55 yr. old male with  a mild case of Rosacea that has dramatically improved as a result of using elta clear. I tried the UV Shield 45 which is a great product as well but after several weeks of use the Rosacea came back. I use the 45 on other areas of exposed skin and reserve the UV Clear for my face. Between the two I'm confident I get  protection from the sun while experiencing "break-out" free skin. My dermatologist recommended UV clear, I'm eternally grateful. This the first review I've ever written but felt compelled to write about my experience in the hope it may help others with Rosacea or acne prone skin. If a 6 Star rating was an option I would check the box.

Works really well for my skin. I have very oily acne prone skin and it doesnt cause me to breakout or add to my oil production. It leaves my skin moisturized and with a nice healthy dewy glow!works very well underneath makeup as long as you give it time to settle into your skin! if you apply makeup right after using this product you will experience some flakiness (from the sunscreen and whatever base makeup you applied) but once you let the sunscreen absorb into your skin youre good to go!
This is the best sunscreen that my wife and I have ever used.  My wife loves that she can use it under her makeup without issues.  Product goes on clear and moisturizes.  Definitely will buy again!

ReviewTitle: Feels like moisturizer, works like sunscreen
ReviewText: I love this stuff! It really feels like a moisturizer, not a sunscreen, and doesn't smell like sunscreen either. It has never broken me out, made me feel greasy, or effected the look of makeup. It's also really hard (for some reason) to find sunscreens with decent ingredients, but this one is great.I loved it right away, but didn't want to review it until I knew it was effective. It feels so much like a moisturizer, that it was hard to believe it would actually block the sun. Well - I wore this, and only this (not even makeup) on my face for a day out in the sun recently. I got red on my shoulders, neck, and everywhere else up top that I didn't have sunscreen on, but my face was completely unphased.There's really something to be said for the feel/smell of something like this. I didn't think I would care much, but the fact that it feels good on my skin actually motivates me to wear it every day. It has also lasted a long time. I ordered this March 8th, and it's now August 3rd and I'm still on my first bottle. One pump is just a little bit more than I need to cover my whole face.The packaging is great too. I love that it's a pump (that works well) and has a cap that actually stays on. That, and the size of the bottle, make it easy for me to keep in my purse so there's no excuse to be without it.

I love this sun screan. My son has very oily skin and a few hours after showering his face was very shinny but now he uses this sunscreen in the morning and his face remains dry and oil free all day! We love it and his dermatologist was even surprised it helped with keeping his face dry all day.

Good, hygienic packaging with an easy to use pump. I got this because I have acne prone skin, and in the past, have suffered sunscreen-induced zits for sun protection. I'm so happy I found a dermatologist recommended sunscreen for this price.The white cast is very slight, barely noticeable. It's got a just-right consistency--not too runny like Biore Aquarich and not too tacky and thick like Alba Botanicas or Derma E.My skin feels a bit dry after using it, but it's nothing a bit of face lotion won't fix.

This is the best sunscreen for my oily face! I put on moisturizer first then this sunscreen because it is rather drying. It doesn’t feel greasy or oily like most sunscreens . It whitens and protects at the same time. It glides onto my skin when you put it on.

ReviewTitle: Best facial sunscreen for my rosacea
ReviewText: The dermatologist recommended this after I had a laser treatment for rosacea and I needed to be out of the sun for 4-6 weeks. Well, I was going to Florida the following week, so that was difficult. I used this every 2 hours. It not only kept the sun off my face, my skin was amazingly clear (and not just from the laser treatment) after just a week. Plus, it’s so moisturizing, I just use this without an additional moisturizer.

Bought this produce because it was recommended by Doctorly. But it leaves a very visible white residue on skin. I've had multiple people let me know that I had white sunscreen on my face and I had to explain I was using a new face moisturizer.There are better products out there.

I have very oily, acne prone skin, and I have to be very careful about which products I use.  Even many products that are marketed as non-comedogenic or for acne prone skin will cause me to break out.  Sunscreens in particular are problematic for me, even those that claim they won't clog pores or cause breakouts.I am truly, truly amazed by this stuff!  I have been using it for about a month now, and I am so surprised that it has not caused me a single breakout!  I'm shocked, really.  Not only has my face remained clear while using the EltaMD Clear, but it also seems less oily.  (Granted I still have excessively oily skin, but less so with this.)I don't mean to be so superfluous, but I truly am amazed with this stuff.  I always thought I would have to choose between acne or sun-damaged skin.  It really is a relief to know I can get sun protection without breaking out.

Love it! Not greasy, absorbs into skin well, moisturizing, and gentle. Will definitely buy again when I run out.

This applies very smoothly, absorbs quickly and very little smell. I have sensitive skin that is allergic to quite a few sunscreens and this one is very gentle and I have had zero reactions. Much cheaper than the Supergoop city serum I was using before this purchase. Will likely repurchase.

I love this, but please go back to the previous container. The "new" container with the dome-like top with the circle hole in it IS THE PITS! I have to pump over and over to get any sunscreen out. And when I do, sometimes it's a little, other times nothing, other times almost next to nothing. It operates almost as though it is close to empty, like you are just getting the last little bit out. But it's brand new. It's really ridiculous packaging. I hate to switch, but this really isn't convenient or user friendly for the consumer.

ReviewTitle: For oily/sensitive skin not so moisturize-ing
ReviewText: This is good! It’s for oily sensitive skin. It absorbs quick! Not so moisturize-ring as it’s for oily skin BUT I like it. Came recommended so gave it a whirl. Definitely a good product.

Having sensitive and acne-prone skin, I am very careful when choosing skincare products. This sunscreen works beautifully! First of all, it calms my skin. Second, it kinda evens out my skin tone and fades red marks on my face. Last, it protects my skin from the sun, duh.Buy it. I swear by this.

Growing up I never really dealt with acne breakout. Maybe just one or two tiny ones every few months, nothing to complain about. It wasn't til I was about 26 years old that my face became a mess. After learning that what I have was hormonal acne from my dermatologist, and that roughly 25% of all Asian female adults experience this, I was pretty bummed out. Getting older, my face became extremely sensitive to everything. It's now sensitive, combo skin but more on the dry side. I tried so many different SPF product from Olay, Aveeno, Neutrogen, and the expensive $100 Lancome SPF. They either made my face a bit oily throughout the day and caused me to breakout. And of course I didn't like the smell or the thickness of SPF. But I really wanted to wear SPF to prevent high-pigmentation dark spots (occurs a lot for Asians) and wrinkles. I struggled for many years trying to find an SPF that will work for me.My coworker, knowing about my skin problem, gave me a sample of ELTA MD SPF for "Dry and Post-Procedure Skin". I tried the sample and loved it. So I found this product recommended for acne-prone skin. I was a bit worried that it might be too different from the Post-Procedure Skin but it's the same. Both have no smell, super super light and easy to spread on my face (spread a thin amount!), and does not make my face oily throughout the day. I have been using it for two weeks and it does not make me breakout. Usually I can tell after a few days if the product makes me break out or not (like the various products indicated above). Of course I still get the occasional breakout when I'm close to my monthly, but I know for sure this product is not the cause of it. The ELTA's SPF active ingredients are completely different from the products indicated above. I really believe those other SPF ingredients are the reason why it causes me to breakout.Bottle Review: I thought I would not like the pump after reading the reviews regarding the pump having issues, but mine work perfectly. It pushes out a perfect amount for my face so I don't feel like I'm wasting product. The bottle seems small for the price, but after using it, it's actually pretty perfect. Because the pump doesn't give you a huge amount, the product should last for a while (also compare to Lancome, this price is awesome!). Also, the small bottle is perfect for throwing it in your purse or travel bag.I highly recommend this product and hope my review help you find the product that works for you!!

ReviewTitle: EltaMD UV Clear Facial Sunscreen Broad-Spectrum SPF 46 for Sensitive or Acne-Prone Skin, Oil-free
ReviewText: This is the best sunscreen for face! Clear and light weight. I can't believe Walmart is now selling it! I used to have to get through dermatologist website. So happy with that and it's cheaper!! I wear everyday on face to keep my skin looking healthy and young....to protect against sun damage.

ReviewText: Would be absolutely perfect without the Niacinimide. Unfortunately it irritated my skin horribly: I had a bumpy rash for weeks on my face, neck, and chest until I figured out what it was. I was able to use it up on my arms, but can't let it touch my face. I love Elta products but won't repurchase. Please make a version with no niacinimide!

I read this book by a dermatologist who suggested elta md for people with problem acne skin. I ordered it online. It has the best feel for a sunscreen on my face out of all the hundreds I've tried. ReviewTitle: It doesn't break me out and works great under makeup!
ReviewText: I'm a 26 year old lady with sensitive, acne prone skin. I have been reluctant to start using anything regularly because of the breakouts sunscreen has given me since my teenage years. Every "specially formulated for face" sunscreen that I've tried has protected me (and my acne scars) from the sun while creating new acne and new spots of hyper-pigmentation left by my acne. After wrangling my acne problem I have been determined to protect my skin and finally came upon this sunscreen. It protects me from the sun, keeps my skin clear, works great under makeup, leaves my skin feeling great (and not greasy), and doesn't leave me with a gray cast. I'm really happy with this product.

ReviewTitle: Only sunscreen that works for me
ReviewText: EltaMd UV Clear SPF 46 was recommended by my dermatologist because my skin is very sensitive and becomes very red around the nose and mouth with many products.  Also, I couldn't find a sun screen that would prevent the brown spots on my face.  I have used this product daily for 2 months now and love that I have no redness and no brown spots!Note that I originally tried EltaMD broad spectrum SPF 40 tinted formula, but it turned my face red.  I loved that it was tinted, so now I make a "cocktail" of my sunscreen by adding a drop of my liquid foundation to the EltaMD UV Clear SPF 46 and mix it together in the palm of my hand before applying.  It's perfect, eliminating any white shadow that can occur with sunscreens and giving me a healthy glow.Lastly, this product is rich and only takes a very small amount for coverage.  That is way I do not hesitate to spend the extra dollars, because it last much longer than the over-the-counter products.

This is an ok sunscreen. It was recommended by my friend who had it recommended by her dermatologist. It is lightweight but it makes my hands feel greasy after i put it on my face. I'm used to having my face feel oily but if my hands ferl greasy, I think my face is a bit greasy too.

ReviewTitle: Helps Me Not Burn - Living in Houston - Dry - One Bottle Per Month - Daily Use
ReviewText: The other doctor-sold creme failed for me in the summer months as it let my face burn and created permanent sunburn damage on my nose. I switched to this 18 months ago and it works great.I use one pump in the morning which covers my face, neck, and chest area. It goes on dry feeling and is not sticky.I have very sensitive skin and many cremes and sunscreens make me break out with a lot of little red dots all over or with pimples. I have been fine with this.For touch-ups I found a tan colored face powder with SPF 50 that is a different brand that lasts 80 minutes. I touch up with that powder throughout the day and other than intense long days in the direct sun without a hat I remain unburned.This bottle lasts me exactly one month with two squirts a day. If you think it is expensive go price the laser treatments to fix permanent sunburn damage, it will run you about two thousand dollars.I love this = 5 stars.

ReviewTitle: be aware of the box and product
ReviewText: I ordered Elta MD UV Clear.  What I got was Elta MD  UV Daily.  There was a sticker on the bottom of the box with a bar code showing it was UV Clear. ReviewTitle: Finally, a sunscreen that works with sensitive skin and doesn't cause breakouts
ReviewText: I have VERY sensitive skin.  My dermatologist started me out with the Obagi suncreen, then the Elta MD regular and then the Neova waterproof.  While all of these products were great as sunscreens, they all caused me to have major problems with breakouts and tons of blackheads.  I switched over to this product and my skin has been flawless ever since.  This does not cause me to have breakouts, or have all of those blackheads I was getting from other sunscreens.  Even though I am 56 years old, my skin is still very oily.  This does not leave my face greasy and works well under my makeup.I read the online reviews prior to ordering and saw where some people were concerned about the authenticity of the product.  This is exactly the same as the product I bought from my dermatologist.  It is also the one that is for rosacea, pigmentation and acne prone skin.
This is the best I’ve found for sensitive acne prone skin. And my purchase here does appear to be the genuine Elta product. It has a printed serial number and performs equally in my experience.

SUNSCREEN: 5 stars. It's a nice compromise between a purely chemical sunscreen (which I'm trying to avoid) and a purely physical sunscreen that often shows up with a white cast or pills under makeup. Also has niacinamide, which is nice since it's good to layer different products with nicacinamide since they often don't appear in effective concentrations within any one product.PACKAGING: 1 star for the terrible airless pump, which doesn't seal correctly (and caused some of the product to leak during shipment). The pump quit working on my second use. I was able to fix it by placing tape around the joint (area above the label) to fix the vacuum seal, but it's still annoying the packaging isn't manufactured correctly.
This is the only sunscreen I have ever tried that does not break me out. Well worth the money. It does not leave a white cast. I really can’t tell that I have it on.

ReviewTitle: Caused terrible red, hot, tight face skin for two days after using it
ReviewText: I have used this sunscreen twice.  The first time I experienced a terrible redness along with tight, hot, puffy skin all over my face.  I assumed it was my fault because I was outside for a few hours in the sun and did not reapply the sunscreen.  It felt as though I had gotten a pretty bad sunburn on my face.I did not use it for about a month as I am not great about applying sunscreen daily unless I am really spending a lot of time in the sun.  I have been trying to find a daily sunscreen to use because I know that I should be using one... so, I tried this again three days ago in hopes that I might be able to start using it daily.I was inside the entire day and did not spend any time in the sun.  That night my face was red, tight, burning, my skin was puffy all over my cheeks and around my eyes.  My skin was hot to the touch again, as though I had a sunburn, which was impossible.  I had applied no other different products than usual besides this sunscreen.  It took another two days for the redness and heat to leave.  I will never use this product again, which is a shame because it was quite expensive.

ReviewTitle: Good Product but Poor Customer Service

I contacted the manufacturer and EltaMD said that they do not communicate with consumers, so you're only recourse is to talk to your seller. Caused lots of tiny breakouts after 1 use; this was the only new thing I used. Rested a few days and tried again. Did the same thing.
My wife loves this product.

I’ve seen numerous reviews and recommendations from dermatologists that have said this sunscreen is wonderful. Well let me tell you, I certainly did not have that feeling, it was awful. Hard to blend, dry, white cast, and broke me out.

ReviewTitle: This is the sun protection product your face really wants!
ReviewText: Excellent product. I've been using it for years. It has the micromilled zinc oxide in it which physically blocks the sun's harmful rays and it goes on smoothly and non-greasy. My makeup looks wonderful on top of this sunscreen and I never burn or break out (I have acne prone skin). You can't find better. It's fantastic!
Goes on smooth. Doesn’t make my face greasy. Love knowing there is a high SPF on my face along with niacinamide. You don’t need much so it lasts longer than you would think.

ReviewTitle: Will not go out without it
ReviewText: This is the best sunscreen I've used.I've not tried a whole lot of other products but this is definitely better than the rest. It does not leave any residue nor does it look oily on your skin nor does it leave your skin dry. It blends in and you cannot identify it's there after 5 minutes of applying it over your skin. I've been using this sunscreen even before my derm had suggested me one.I apply two squirts of this sunscreen on top of my moisturizer  for my face and it stays perfect.The only con is it's pricey for its size.
It's easy under make up, not greasy, and I have not experienced any break outs. I have used tizo, and I like this one better.

Depend upon this stuff as work in sun, wind, and filth plus have lifelong deal with acne.This "modern" sunlight (different than when I was a kid), feels white-hot in laser-like intensity so sun block's a must as-is the donning of sensible coverup like eye protection, long sleeves, and visors or brimmed hats. The guys I work with don't bother--or haven't rather, perhaps having pegged sun protection as a vanity issue--then inevitably scurry to do so once the docs start hacking pieces off their ears, lips, or nose due to the insideous and unfortunate melanoma prevalent amongst those of us with outdoor occupations...Appreciate it's mild moisturizing quality plus decent 46 sun protection potency and typically apply it up to three times (or every two/three hours as per bottle instructs), on any given workday out in the (construction) field.Drugstore brands, though obviously less expensive, leave me with disgusting, aggravating, cystic acne skin each-and-every time, but not this stuff, thank goodness!True, it's is not particularly sheer or transparent, at least upon initial application, however that's okay by me as it tames down my otherwise ruddy or rather weather beaten face (disregarded sunscreen use when younger), with a "lighter", hence, younger hue and again, offers a more moist or dewy, perhaps glistening appearance than I would otherwise have as a "mature" 51 year old woman with a lifelong occupation in the trades.Thanks guys and keep making this stuff! :)

ReviewTitle: This has been my absolute favorite daily moisturizer/sunscreen for a few years
ReviewText: This has been my absolute favorite daily moisturizer/sunscreen for a few years. I have acne prone skin and this product is not greasy and does not cause me to break out. It absorbs quickly and doesn't leave your skin feeling heavy.In the winter time when I am more prone to dry spots, I will use a heavier moisturizer in addition to this sunscreen when needed.

I was introduced to this by my dermatologist.  Best sunscreen that isn't heavy at all and not over scented!  It's super light weight and non-greasy.  My face doesn't break out.  I don't recommend using it too close to the eye area. I had a reaction when I put it too close to my eyes.  My lids developed a rash and then peeled.  A little pricey but a little bit goes a LONG way.

I had such high hopes for this sunscreen. I'm a bit of a sunscreen enthusiast, and with such great reviews and ingredients I was expecting this to become one of my favorites. However, this just doesn't sink nicely into skin. It goes on clear which is great, but it balls up into little white flakes, and basically flakes off the skin. The application isn't so bad if you apply to straight to clean, dry skin with no moisturizer...but moisturizer is a must for me. Big disappointment considering the price.
I wanted to love this stuff but it leaves a white cast and it’s soooooo dry. Just an uncomfortable sunscreen to wear in general
Go to SPF. It really doesn’t clog my pores and there isn’t a white cast like so many other mineral sunscreens. It’s a great product overall.

ReviewTitle: Best sunscreen for the face - great under make-up!
ReviewText: Best sunscreen for the face! I use this daily under my foundation make-up. It is not greasy,..it's great under make-up...your make up stays in place. I apply it with a make up sponge, the white wedge sponges. Even on days that I am outdoors a lot, it still does a great job of sun protection, without needing to re-apply. I also apply it to the back of my hands to prevent sun damage and age spots on my hands. It absorbs well and is not greasy at all.

I have very sensitive skin and this is so gentle that there is absolutely no stinging around my eyes. Little how’s a long way so it lasts me a while. Just one full pump for my face and I’m good. Will continue to buy this over and over. It’s a holy grail sunscreen.
I’ve been searching for this product! Most facial sunscreens either leave me shiny or with a white film on my skin. Not this one! It is light and goes on under or over my makeup no problem.
The only product I have found that doesn't irritate my face

ReviewTitle: I have no Roseaca flair ups using this product.
ReviewText: I really like it. My Roseaca does not seem to flair when I put this on which most sunscreens are chemical and my face turns red as soon as I put it on. This one is a keeper.  The only thing I wish was that it was a little thicker but that is because I have very dry skin.  I use moisturizers over this and it works fine.  I would recommend it .

I was first introduced to this moisturizer by my dermatologist.  I had used the EltaMD brand before but this is a much better sunscreen for use on the face.  The cream is light and works well under make up or alone.  It also helps keep your skin clear.  I have used this as an everyday cream and also at the beach and have had great results.I would highly suggest this cream to anyone looking for a light sunscreen that really works.

ReviewTitle: Safe for sensitive eyes and oily skin.
ReviewText: No oil slick! No eye irritation! Ok under make-up. Would order again.
I like this sunscreen because it is very light. Very easy to apply.

I wanted to like this, I really did.  I loved the consistency, the minimal ingredients, the shape of the bottle - everything.  Unfortunately my skin became extremely flaky after using this product and I've concluded that I cannot tolerate zinc oxide; such a bummer!  I still recommend this for those that have no issue with the ingredients!
I really like this sunscreen. It is very light and just slips on your skin. It is invisible. I have rosacea, and it does not irritate it.
I'm not super sure why people think this stuff is amazing. I find it too oily and very similar to my body sunscreen. I prefer the la roche posay face sunscreen.
Never clog my pore!!I tried tons of uv products. This is the best
Best facial sunscreen there is.  I've tried them all and nothing compares to this.  I struggle with melasma and hormonal acne and this is the only thing that works for me!

ReviewTitle: I finally decided to try it -- and am so glad I did
ReviewText: I've been reading about this sunscreen in beauty magazines (where it's won several "best of" awards) and in my dermatologist's office for a few years, but have held off on buying it since it's so costly. I finally decided to try it -- and am so glad I did! It's honestly the best facial sunscreen that I have ever used!The formulation is very smooth and elegant, and it doesn't have any of that awful sunscreen smell or tackiness to it. It also plays well with other products; each morning, I apply my Paula's Choice antioxidants and let them sink in for a minute, then I apply this and let it sink in, and then I apply my foundation/makeup. It doesn't cause pilling or balling with your foundation.It also doesn't leave a white cast the way other foundations sometimes do, and I really appreciate the high SPF since I've had some pre-cancerous spots removed.It's a lovely product!
Love Elta sunscreen. It is the only one my dermatologist recommends!
It went on very smooth. I loved the texture and it blended well into my darker skin tone. My complexion did not look milky but natural. Love it!
This is the best sunscreen that I have ever used. It is lightweight and lasts for an entire day.

ReviewTitle: Amazing, clear, thin, clean, dries -- BUY THIS!
ReviewText: This is the most amazing face lotion I've ever tried AND it has SPF 46.  I have acne-prone skin and fair complexion, so it's very difficult to find a face lotion that works well for me. Most lotions feel oily or sticky or make my face shiny and greasy all day.  I have been using a Cetaphil lotion for awhile and that works well, but is only SPF 15.  This lotion is exactly as advertised and like the reviews I read: it goes on clear. It dries immediately. It is very thin. You don't need a lot--a pea size is a little more than I need to cover my face.  This lotion moisturizes but feels like I'm not wearing any lotion.  I've never had a face lotion feel that way and don't know how they do it.I work out hard every morning, so after my shower, it takes awhile to cool off.  I can put this lotion on and it still dries, even though my body hasn't cooled down.  I also swim frequently.  For anyone that swims, you know that after you get out of the pool and maybe take a shower, your face feels very taught.  After putting a little of this lotion on, my face feels normal, but is still dry to the touch.Lastly, the price.  Yes, it seems a little high, but in the grander scheme of things, it is absolutely worth it.  I need a good moisturizer with high SPF to wear on a daily basis and this fits the bill.  My skin is also prone to hyperpigmentation, which is hard to undo and can become embarrassing on a professional level.  I work outside sometimes and I also enjoy being outside as much as possible.  If I'm going to be in the direct sun all day, I will add another SPF 85-100 lotion on top of this.  Otherwise, this is plenty and I've been very pleased to see my skin protected from a product I forget I'm wearing.  Also, I learned my dermatologist office swears by this line of products. Last time I was there, we had a good chat about why they love  them and that reinforced my reasons for buying this.

I have sensitive combination skin and I love this! It is by far my new favorite moisturizer and totally worth the cost. My dermatologist recommended this for me and I’m really glad I spent the money and did it.
Got fried first day w/windburn. Applied to face and hands rest of golf trip. 36 holes a day protection. No drip into eyes. No further burn. Awesome!  Will never take out of my golf bag.
I actually hated this. my face fried w it on in comparison to spf 30. doesn't work well w makeup. broke out. all around ass product.

Awesome sunscreen, I have tried many different sunscreens but this one if by far the best one so far. Doesn’t cause breakouts, good for oily skin and love that it doesn’t affect the way your make up wears over it. Would definitely recommend this product to everyone!!
I love how weightless this is. No strong smells, no white cast, and perfect for under makeup !
This is a good product for sensitive skin, light with no fragrance. Easy to dispense.

I LOVE THIS! My sister has been using this and her skin is amazing. I asked her what she had been using and she pointed to this little bottle. I use my Clinique moisturizer (without SPF) at night and I put this product on in the mornings. I love this. Buy it!
I had my 3rd purchase. Love the product.

ReviewTitle: Not bad. I still like the Elta MD Shield SPF ...
ReviewText: Not bad. I still like the Elta MD Shield SPF 45 best in terms of texture and after-feel and it never felt Shield had a after-white that negatively affected me. But since Clear has niacinamide in it for the added benefit of improving skin, it's my current go-to, although its after feel is a little stickier than the Shield. However, I haven't used Shield long enough to see skin texture improvements from the niacinamide I think.

I love this!  Non-irritating & not sticky or shiny.... hard to find in a sunscreen!  I have combination skin and struggle to find products that work with my skin.  I added a little concealer and it is perfect for a “no makeup” day. : )
I have been peeling from Retin-A and my skin was sensitive. I had non problem using this product. Gentle on the skin and great feeling as well.
Gives me fantastic protection from sun without irritating my face.

This stuff dried out my skin and I have rashes. Not worth it at all.

ReviewTitle: can't use it, made my skin dry
ReviewText: Read a lot of good reviews about this so I decided to try it. Unfortunately, it made my skin dry so I have to stop using it and look for another sunscreen. It's a shame because the consistency and smell is nice. It's easy to put on and does not leave a whitish tinge on my face. The dry skin is just the issue.

ReviewTitle: A great alternative for sensitive skin that normally breaks out with sunscreen! Also great for children's sensitive eyes & face.
ReviewText: I live in Denver (which averages more than 300 sunny days per year), so I need to wear sunscreen almost daily to protect my face from sun damage.  However, I've been guilty in the past of neglecting to wear sunscreen on my face to avoid the usual clogged pores and/or breakout that follows. This product has proven to be a miracle sunscreen for my face.  With SPF 46, it fully protects my skin from the damaging rays of the sun and has never left my skin feeling greasy or my pores clogged.  Furthermore, it has never caused my face to breakout.  It provides all of the protection you could ask for without the devastating results of many over-the-counter general sunscreens.  My dermatologist first recommended this product after I had a blemish, which had darkened dramatically during pregnancy, lasered off of my face.  However, because I have sensitive skin that is susceptible to breakouts, I have continued to purchase this product for my daily use facial sunscreen.  In addition, I have started to use this sunscreen as facial protection on my 1 and 3-year-old children because it has high SPF protection, but doesn't irritate their eyes like most sunscreens if they rub their eyes after application.
Great coverage and perfect under makeup! Goes on smooth and doesn’t leave my face greasy. Will buy again!

ReviewTitle: Excellent texture, coverage that lasts, good for oily skin
ReviewText: This is a great facial sunscreen that I use on myself, husband, and toddler when we are doing outdoor activities. It applies very easily and stays put with no greasy shine on my oily skin. I don't use it for daily use however due to the faint white cast on my light/medium olive tone skin.
Like it

Best SPF I have ever used.  I have tried a bazillion different types of SPF lotions/creams and always find them to be irritating and either way too drying or way too greasy feeling.  I paid an arm and a leg for a few shiseido brand SPF moisturizers such as the Ultimate Sun Protection (in the blue and orange bottle) and the Urban Environment Protectant (white bottle) after reading reviews on Sephora raving about the products.  IMO, they were too watery for my liking, pilled, and irritated/dried out my skin.  I have combination/dry/sensitive skin and have lived with eczema my whole life.  I've also tried a few Aveeno SPF products and have always had the same reaction.  Halfway through the day, I just feel dirty.  (I know a lot of yall have felt that way before too with SPF products! Let's be real!)  And want to wash everything off bc the SPF is so uncomfortable and I can feel it sitting on my skin.Anywho, I have been trying different retinol serums and AHA/BHA exfoliants, so I need to make sure I'm applying SPF whenever I go outside (even if just for a few minutes).  I apply this after cleansing/moisturizing.  Absorbs quickly and does not make me feel greasy or dry.  Haven't noticed any white cast or pilling either.  I would compare the texture to the Aveeno daily SPF moisturizers that come with a pump.  Kind of thick but surprisingly not heavy once applied.  My skin is not complaining! Highly recommend!
The bottle I received must be old because the cream was yellow instead of white

ReviewTitle: Not Meant for People of Color
ReviewText: This sunscreen is great... if you’re white. Was excited to finally find a facial sunscreen that was moisturizing and wouldn’t leave me looking like a ghost. Unfortunately, I was wrong. While subtle, this sunscreen will give you a white cast over your skin and leave you looking dull. My skin is ordinarily vibrant, vibrant and glowy. Immediately after applying this on my face it looks dull and discolored. Try another sunscreen that is completely clear onto your skin.
I'm sure this lotion does a good job of sun protection. Unfortunately, I found it a little too thick for my liking. I also felt it gave me a pallor. [Maybe the tinted version would be better?]
Still best sunscreen on the market.  Tried other brands, but always come back to this one

Absolutely wonderful makes my skin feel nice and goes on cleanly with no white sheen. I have tan skin so other products show up and I was so relieved with this one not doing that. Not to mention its not tacky on my skin.

ReviewTitle: Not oily or pick out all
ReviewText: Great if you don’t want shiny skin and still want sunscreen coverage
This is a great sun protection for my highly sensitive skin! So glad I tried it!

I give this product a 3 Star and a 4 Star. How is that possible? Confusing I know. Here are my reasons for the 3 Star Rating. Since I began using this at the prompting of the dermatologist my skin has dried out significantly. I tend to have sensitive skin and have to be careful with what I use. However, I did start with some other topical treatments a few days before starting the Elta Clear. I didn't have any issues with those products, so don't know if it's a build up, or a combination of those with the Elta Clear. I have a follow up with the dermatologist in a couple of weeks and will discuss with them, which, if any, of all of the new topicals may be causing the dryness.Reasons for the 4 Star Rating. I have not spent a ton of time outdoors since beginning to use this product, but I am outside more than I was before. That being said, so far, I have not had any burns. That is significant because my tendency is to burn, blister, peel, and burn again.
I’m obsessed with this stuff. There are a lot of reviews about not getting the real product but I’ve bought it twice from Amazon and never had a problem.

ReviewTitle: This product now replaces more expensive skin products!
ReviewText: This product now replaces my more expensive origins products! It makes my skin feel greatand protects my skin from the sun (especially since as a pilot I am exposed to the sun so much)! Since switching it has not caused any negative skin break outs etc. love it. Btw, it was recommended by a dermatologist.

Sunscreen in the past after a few hours starts to feel slick on skin however Elta MD does not. I like that it is just sunscreen and not moisturizer sunscreen which does not provide enough coverage on my fair skin. If you super fair like me, then this sunscreen is worth the investment.

It is too drying for me by itself, though, and it does not have a high enough PPD to wear in the summertime, so it is going to be my winter sunscreen, but come spring I'll be on the hunt again.

After using this I have noticed The bags under my eyes are tighter and don't seem so tired. I love this product!
I wear this daily and absolutely love it. I have no breakouts and all my friends want to use it. My face doesn’t feel oily and I feel very protected in the sun.

ReviewText: The only sunscreen that works for my very sensitive, acne prone, and hyperpigmented skin. My dermatologist sells this in her office. This is the first sunscreen I've found that overcomes all of my specific objections. I wish it were much less expensive. But here's what it does that no other sunscreen can match:1) It leaves a dry matte finish on my skin. No oily coat that looks like makeup and leaches into my eyes.2) It is remarkably transparent. Other products suggest they they, too, use "invisible" micronized zinc particles. But every other one I've tried leaves a noticeable white coat on my face.3) It can go on my scalp! I can blend it up into my thinning hairline.The shine of other products just looks like grease when it gets on my hair. Exactly what every man wants: a greasy scalp with flat hair that sticks to your reflective noggin. But this "dry finish" is the feature I've been trying to find for years, and it's why I pay Elta's high price. I can smear it over my bald spot and thin patches...and it looks like nothing. My hair still stands up. My hair and scalp look exactly like they did moments earlier. No better. But not worse. I have strong protection without looking like an old Brylcreem ad.

ReviewTitle: Great sunscreen - don't hesitate to buy it
ReviewText: Great sunscreen that does not feel thick. It absorbs nicely into your skin and feels good even under make-up.

For those that have searched for a magical face sunscreen that doesn't irritate acne, create a white film over your face, make your face look greasy, or smell like pina coladas, fear not!  This sunscreen was recommended by my dermatologist, and I can say that it is definitely worth the price.  First off, I have problem skin so I am already paying a ridiculous amount of money for products that are meant to keep your skin clear and the number one rule that dermatologists give you is to wear sunscreen... but that is usually such an issue because it normally counteracts all of my ridiculously expensive product by clogging my pores and irritating my acne. This sunscreen does neither.  It was created for people with sensitive or acne prone skin so it actually helps and works with your acne products.  It's also a great moisturizer!  It doesn't leave a film, though at first you may feel like your skin is oily (that's just how it looks/feels at first).  It also works, and everyone compliments me on my glow- little do they know that I actually protect my skin and create an artificial glow with bronzer.  You only need a small amount and it last forever.  I've been using it everyday since August and I still have some left.  For everyone still not convinced, please note that you will not look like a tourist if you wear this to the beach- believe me, everyone always asks if I am wearing sunscreen at all, or if I need to reapply because you CANNOT TELL THAT I AM WEARING IT.  Lastly, it acts as the perfect primer for your makeup.  I wear it everyday, regardless of whether or not I am wearing makeup that day, and nothing runs/smears/does something nasty.  BUY IT.  Your skin will thank you.

It has the best sunblock agents in it because the zinc oxide is a physical barrier to the sun and the octinoxate is a chemical barrier.  It also has an anti-inflammatory agent in it, so if you are using acne meds that irritate your skin, this helps cool the redness.It is lighter than other sunscreens I have tried with zinc oxide (like Shiseido); it rubs in better, and washes off more easily.  Also, the price here is the best I have seen.

Delivery:I gave this product three stars because some of the contents of the bottle were inside of the cap. Product is either used or damaged during shipment, although I believe it can't be the latter since the cap is undamaged. I would return it if i didnt need this sunscreen today.Product:Now let's talk about the fun part: Elta MD's clear sunscreen with niacinamide! If you're acne-prone or have acne marks/hyperpigmentation you want niacinamide on your face. Unless of course your face doesn't like it (patch test just in case).Acne marks/hyperpigmentation on your skin grow darker in the sun. This product protects you from the sun AND lightens the mark as you wear it! Niacinamide is MAGIC.Application:If you have very oily/normal skin, I suggest applying this on a bare face. If you have any dry patches or your skin is tight (like me) moisturize first and let that sink in. Now you can put EltaMD clear on. Wait 15 mins before applying your makeup. Be gentler than usual when you apply your makeup so the sunscreen stays in place.*2hrs later*As you've probably read before, sunscreen needs to be reapplied throughout the day. With this sunscreen it's easy to reapply with your makeup on. When it's time to reapply I first press drops of grapeseed oil on dry patches on my skin and let that sink in. Then you apply the sunscreen with small tapping motions rather than rubbing it in to keep your makeup in place. I spritz myself with some hydration tonic by blissoma and I'm good to go!

ReviewTitle: Long-time user loves all their products
ReviewText: While Amazon is not an authorized seller of Elta MD products, I have purchased from Amazon 3 tubes of the 47 SPF sport cream, one bottle of the larger pump bottle with 47 SPF, 2 bottles of the Clear 46 SPF for face, 2 tubes of the lightly colored facial cream and all of them (8 bottles/tubes) have been consistent in color, smell (none), viscosity and strength.  I have trusted these products to apply to my 12 year old every day in the summer while going to surf camp, boy scout camp, etc.  I have never gotten a sunburn while wearing these products.  I wear these products everyday in sunny So. California.  There is no smell and I have a hound-dog nose.  I think Elta wants you to purchase there products only from dermatologists in order to keep their prices high and maintain an exclusive image, however, I have never been dissatisfied with the products purchased on Amazon.  They work.  I am an avid reader of Skin Deep and want to make sure that the products I use will not hurt me.

ReviewText: This lotion goes on underneath my makeup better than any other SPF lotion. It's very lightweight and protects my skin well -- I have fair skin and have never suffered a sunburn wearing it -- even after I pack on the makeup on top. It's not greasy and rubs in very well, too.

ReviewTitle: One of the greatest skincare products of all time
ReviewText: I've become a skincare guru after battling severe acne for over 10 years. While using Retin-A, and later Accutane, I learned about the importance of sunscreen, but never found one I liked. They all had one of these problems: smelled bad, left a greasy film, left a white cast, or were ineffective. A friend introduced me to Elta MD UV Shield, which had none of these problems, and I fell in love.After finishing a round of Accutane, my acne eventually came back in full force. My dermatologist didn't let me go back on Accutane, because she said that I was considered a new acne patient now, and must start from the beginning. i tried every topical product to no avail, and was about to throw in the towel when I discovered that Elta MD had new product out called UV Clear. I fell in love all over again.Instead of various cleansers, moisturizers, toners, serums, creams, etc., my routine has now been reduced to the following: 1. Wash face with plain water. 2. Apply UV Clear.That's it. My skin has been the clearest it has ever been. Oily skin is no longer a problem. I don't have to go back onto Accutane. If there was a single skincare product that I would say had the greatest impact on my life, I would say UV Clear without reservation.

Absorbs well into my dark skin and I haven't experienced any breakouts or allergic reactions. Despite the size of the bottle, this sunscreen lasts for months. I've used it everyday since I received it in November and it hasn't run out yet.

ReviewText: I am the type of person that HATES the feeling of sunscreen, moisturizer, or any kind of liquid/lotion product on my face and I only started regularly wearing sunscreen about two years ago when I turned 25. I won't lie, I still don't use it daily but I try to use it on days where I know I'll be outside or in the car a lot. This sunscreen is NOT WATERPROOF or SWEATPROOF which sucks because when I swim or sweat, it drips into my eyes and burns, so in the summer I just use regular waterproof sunblock. The good thing about the Eltamd is that it dries quickly and is pretty sheer, and it comes in a pump bottle so it also mixes well with most liquid makeup. The cons are obviously that it's not waterproof or sweat proof and it burns/stings a lot if it gets in your eyes due to water or sweat.

ReviewTitle: An AWESOME product that has it all!
ReviewText: This is by far the best facial sunscreen I have ever used, and there have been several.  My dermatologist recommended a product with zinc oxide that offered protection from UVB and UVA rays.  In the past any sunscreen I tried made my face break out or super oily.  This formula has done neither. It has both lactic and  hyaluronic acid which has helped keep my skin clear and reduce shine.  I love that it comes in a pump which keeps the product fresh and clean.  It doesn't leave a white cast either.  It dries completely clear so it doesn't interfere with any makeup I apply.  One tip I would share is to allow time for it to absorb into your skin before applying foundation.  It takes less than 5 minutes.  We recently returned from a week on the beach in Florida and my skin looks great; no burns, freckles or brown spots.  I love it!

ReviewTitle: Not great for acne prone skin

I've tried countless facial sunscreens. It's very important to me to have full protection, as I had a basal cell carcinoma removed two years ago, and have been strongly cautioned by my dermatologist never to leave the house without sunscreen on. It's very difficult to make a high SPF broad spectrum facial sunscreen, apparently, because I have yet to find one that doesn't have something major wrong with it--they are either too thin and runny, or too thick and white. Elizabeth Arden used to make a great one, with SPF 50, but inexplicably it only screened Utra Violet A rays, and not B. Go figure. Anyway, they discontinued it (why does that always happen? Makers stop making good products-?) so it's moot. I'll keep looking, because Eltamud isn't it.

ReviewText: It's a very light, moisturising cream with high SPF which is always a good thing.The best thing for me was that in combination with the Clean and Clear scrub I was able to discontinue the use of benzonyl peroxide - haven't had a major (or minor)  breakout since using this cream.I usually apply it once a day under makeup before heading out of the house, and in the evening I use oil-based moisturiser with loads of nourishing and acne-preventing essential oils.Seems to work for me.

ReviewTitle: Great alone or under makeup for sensitive and/or oily skin.
ReviewText: I have been using this product for 6 months by recommendation from my dermatologist. My face has speckled sun spots (giraffe spotting) and occasional break-outs. I use an additional prescribed product for the acne and the need for a strong protective sunblock is a must.  I prefer the "tinted" solution over the "clear" of this Elta MD UV Broad Spectrum.  The tint is similar to a medium foundation shade. I don't feel the coverage is heavy.  The solution is creamy and lightweight and rubs in well like a lotion. It will not completely cover my sun spots, but I do feel the overall product blends my multi-shade face well without adding additional makeup. By mid-day, I have minimal sheen. *NOTE when sweating, if you wipe your face you will remove the product and color transfer will be on your towel. It does NOT stain.Recommended for sensitive, oily or sun-spotted faces.(39 yr-old, caucasian-japanese, medium skin shade, tans easily, very oily face, acne prone.)
I used several EltaMD products and will be adding this to my list of favs! Its lightweight on the skin!

This sunscreen is pretty expensive, but it's worth it. Im trying to avoid sunscreens with questionable chemicals/hormones and I've tried many other less expensive zinc-oxide sunscreens. This is leagues above the rest.- Applies clear/none of that white haze- Light & doesn't feel heavy on your skin- Easy to apply/spread- No artificial scent

Because of this, I had to start washing my face at night. All in all, it's one of those things I should do anyway! It doesn't block my pores as much as other microparticulates do. Completely worth every penny (or a $20 and a $10). I would have saved tons of money had I not wasted my time with cheaper products that are sitting in my bathroom practically full.

ReviewTitle: Drying, white cast, chemical smell, but nice pump dispenser
ReviewText: I bought this on Amazon in 2013 and used it, along with one other ss, going back and forth to evaluate and compare the two. I have re-ordered the other but not this one. I don't like this sunscreen because it makes my skin feel dry (and I have really oily skin), and leaves a white cast if I use the amount needed to get the sun protection touted. There is also a weird smell--very chemically--that I dislike. I can handle strong scents, but this one isn't right. There are  too many chemical ingredients to feel comfortable using this on my face daily. I really do like keys moisturizer with 30+ spf; it has 20% zinc and only a handful of natural ingredients--and it doesn't leave my oily skin feeling dry and tight. I do like the air pump dispenser.

So this product is great on bare morning skin. It absorbs fast, dries clear (so long as you rub it in!) and doesn't have that horrible sunscreeny film--an impressive feat for such a high SPF product. Since I live in Texas and often work outside, having a great sunblock integrated into my daily care is a necessity, and this one is certainly worth the price for the protection and feel. However, I have to wait longer than what works in my morning routine to put it on under my Origins Plantscription foundation. If I give it less than 10 minutes, the suncreen balls up and rubs off with very, very little friction. In the battle for most important product, the UV Clear wins so I'll be looking for a foundation that works better on top. Kind of a bummer for what everyone has called such a low fuss product.

I'm 37 and have tried every conceivable kind of facial sunscreen. They have always been too greasy, too shiny, melted off in the heat, left white residue, or felt heavy- some even burn my face.  The EltaMD UV Clear SPF46 is so light it doesn't feel as though you have anything on your face.  I work in a public school (NO air conditioning) in the Northeast where it is hot and humid during the summer.  Even in my swampy building, the Elta sunscreen held up.  Yes, it costs more than Neutrogena, but it is so much better!  Since Elta does cost about 3x more, I use it for my sunscreen for work, when I need to look a little more presentable. If you are on the fence, just try it- Amazon has a generous return policy, and you may just find your favorite sunscreen too!

ReviewTitle: Please don't waste anytime researching this is the best of the best..I've done the research for you!
ReviewText: It's strange buying something for my face that is so low priced..and then I saw this line and my derms office..amazon makes sells this for waaaay lower so if you are a beauty product snob just know they charge over 50.00. I actually have dry skin but this product has niacinimide which acts as a moisture barrier for all skin types. I still where a lightweight moisturizer along with it sometimes but it's only when I'm not applying a moisturizing bb creme or Chanel vitalumiere..if I'm wearing any makeup with moisture (always I use light makeup) elta md clear for acne problem skin never dries me out. Another bonus is that if I'm in a rush and I can only wash my face..I sometimes only apply this and nothing more. It really leaves my skin luminescent...and I'm sure it's because of the niacinimide. Just so you can imagine how good this is...it's as good as Sunday Riley cashmere sunscreen (150.00) and I'm not giving elta the advantage because of the cost difference it's as good on its own. The other sunscreen I used which is great as good as elta is cle de Peu SPF 50. The more expensive ones still don't offer the chemical engineering of adding ingredients that sustain moisture levels and keep our skin clear. I'm 33 and obsessed with products...so I love to keep changing but this is a staple. Do yourself a favor and step into the last brand of sunscreen you'll ever want!!

ReviewTitle: my experience is from someone who doesn't have acne but used this sunscreen bc i read it was really good. that being said- when

ReviewText: This is the best sunscreen I have ever tried, and I have been trying sunscreens for 15+ years at drugstores, Sephora, the department store, etc. EltaMD sunscreens will not cause breakouts, and this formulation (UV Clear) is incredibly fast absorbing and light. I have sensitive skin that does not respond well to chemical sunscreens such as avobenzone, and my facialist applied EltaMD (the post-facial formulation, which has more emollience) after a microdermabrasion treatment. She told me this product's zinc oxide not only effectively blocks sunscreen, but also has calming properties on skin and an optical brightening effect due to the micronized zinc oxide particles.Ever since that day I have been using the EltaMD UV Clear SPF 46 on a daily basis because this an exceptional formulation. In addition it is priced competitively: you can't be too precious about sunscreen because its efficacy depends on consistent, daily use: slather it on every morning, regardless of sun or rain (because UV rays penetrate office windows, car windows, clouds, etc.). With this product and its attractive price point, I can afford to use it generously everyday without feeling as though I need to be delicate about application.Best of all, it doesn't rely on drying ingredients to impart a "dry touch" feel like a certain popular drugstore brand. EltaMD's sunscreens, in particular the UV Clear formula, sinks in immediately. I wear it under makeup and there has never been any pilling, white reflection, or other problems. It doubles as an excellent primer for foundation.I've been buying this in bulk for 3+ years now, and I can't imagine ever using another facial sunscreen unless there is a revolution in the sunscreen market.

Works great without causing irritation or acne. I have tried many different sunblocks for my aging, acne-prone face and THIS is the only product that hasn't caused redness or any signs of acne. I have been using this on a daily basis for three weeks now with no side-effects, which is a first for me.Here is a partial list of products that I have tried for facial sun-protection: Skinceuticals - 2 formulations, Neutrogena, Lavera - 1 for face, 1 for children, Aveeno, Mustela - baby stick style. I had to stop using each of the aforementioned products because they either caused extreme irritation and/or made my face breakout. Because, I was determined to find a product to use on my face, if I only broke out (without burning, redness or peeling)I would try it a few more times to make sure the acne was a result of the product. Also, To be fair, Aveeno and Mustela were ones that I tried several years ago and I see that they have new products on the market now.I chose Eltamd UV Clear SPF 46 based on customer reviews and I am extremely grateful to those who took the time to review this product.

ReviewTitle: Elta MD UV Clear SPF 46 - Really like it!!
ReviewText: This product was recommended to me by my Dermatologist.  I have always had combo/oily skin and a problem with Acne, continuing into adulthood.  I finally have the acne under control and this product is wonderful!  Many SPF's feel heavy on the face and take forever to rub in, and seem to stay "white" on your face for a while.  The Elta MD product is much finer than other SPF products, and therefore does not give your face that whitish tint.  It rubs in quickly and does not feel greasy later!  I am often outdoors in the Phoenix sun/heat for my job.  Lasts all day, wears extremely well under makeup or alone and will not make you shiny!!  It is truly a GREAT product!

Basically, this caused me to break out into cystic acne in my oilier regions and caused really red, flaky rashes in my dry patches.  I looked like I had eczema.  Something in this sunscreen just did not sit well with my dry combination sensitive skin. ReviewTitle: Made a mess of my skin
ReviewText: This seemed like a quality product and I absolutely loved that it left no ghostly pallor to my medium brown skin. However, like many of the writers of most of the other more negative reviews, I too experienced a really awful reaction to this. I started using it while on vacation, and within a couple of days my face and neck were blanketed with a terrible rash. My skin is covered in tiny bumps, and is reddish and painful. I continued to use EltaMD for a few more days after the reaction started as I chalked my skin's strange flare up to the transition to a very warm humid climate (due to the product's description, I really thought it couldn't be the Eltamd that was causing it).Unfortunately, by the time I stopped using it (after 5 daily applications), even my most basic and gentle skin care products stung pretty badly. It's now a couple of days later and my skin is still a mess. Needless to say, I will not be continuing to use it. I'm disappointed that it didn't work for me, it really seemed like the perfect product in my search for a non-chalky, non-comedogenic, fragrance-free facial sunscreen. If you do try it, just be really attentive to how your skin responds within the few days or so and discontinue use ASAP if you experience irritation.

ReviewTitle: Great choice if you have acne scars!
ReviewText: This is the fist sunscreen I've tried that I'm willing to wear everyday. For reference, I'm 22 years old, Caucasian, acne-prone, with somewhat oily skin. My main skincare goals are preventing sun damage, preventing acne, and getting rid of my acne-scars (or post-inflamatory hyperpigmentation).I absolutely love this sunscreen! Most importantly, it has good broad spectrum protection (SPF 46 and PPD rating of 16.37, or PA+++). I had to e-mail the company to find out the PPD rating.Secondly, it is the most cosmetically elegant sunscreen I've tried. When it goes on, there is a white cast that is only visible for a few seconds, it quickly fades (although I'm pretty pale, so your milage may vary if you have darker skin). At first, the finish is somewhat greasy but if you let it absorb into your skin for 10-20 minutes, the greasiness subsides. It also looks good under my matte mineral powder foundation. After applying this sunscreen and my foundation I end up with a mostly matte but slightly dewey finish. I like it. It also doesn't make my skin get super greasy over the course of the day. It has not given me any pimples. It's moisturizing, but not super moisturizing.Now I'm getting to the best part - this product has niacinamide. If you don't know what niacinamide is, google it. It's the most magical ingredient. (BTW this is the reason that this sunscreen is slightly more expensive than the other EltaMD sunscreens). More sunscreen companies should make sunscreens with niacinamide! It makes perfect sense, because this is a product that helps fade acne scars. The sun makes acne scars much worse/darker. SO with this sunscreen you are (1) preventing your scars from getting worse and (2) actively fading them! I've seen visible results in only 2 weeks on scars that I've had for YEARS! I have before & after pictures to prove it, and would post them here if I could.TL;DR: If you want to protect your skin from the sun and fade acne scars at the same time, this is the product for you. It is well worth the money. If you don't have any acne scars, I'd probably save a little cash and look into EltaMD UV Physical.

Know that time when you change EVERY product in your routine because youre breaking out, have a rash, or your skin is irritated. Youre trying to find what is causing your porcelain skin to become a red, acne-inflamed mess? Well, that explains about 4 months of my life with this product. I changed my cleanser, toner, moisturizer, exfoliant, serum, etc. NOTHING CHANGED. Then I said let me try to change this product that is SUPPOSEDLY so amazing. Lets see if this is causing the red bumps and the irritated skin! Within 2 days I cleared up about 60%. After a week, I was 90% better. This dumb product is the worst. I dont even know why I tried it.Its silky but it leaves a NOTICEABLE shine on your face. I already have oily skin, I don't need extra shine! Also, my skin felt like it was suffocating, as if the sunscreen were like a plastic bag draining air out of my pores. Im not even being dramatic because the feel of this sunscreen was horrid on my skin. I dont know why I put up with it. I thought it had to be good because everyone ravess about this. Well people on makeupalley.com had the same problem as me, and this product is not recommended my oily, acne-prone people. Youd do better going for elta's spf 45, choosing some liquid SPF, or just not wearing spf at all.
