I hate sunscreen. I hate going to the beach and slathering it on and sweating and coming back at the end of the day with an oily, mildly broken out face that takes forever to clear back up (mostly because I have to keep putting it on if I go back out to beach/pool/whatever).That said, I have been trying to jump on the bandwagon of people who acknowledge that as annoying as it is, sunscreen is necessary if I want to protect my skin and prevent a lot of the issues I'd be paying for later otherwise. So I've tried several. I've done the regular face sunscreens from the drugstore - there are some that are okay but still leave me oily later in the day (combination skin) and prone to milia. I've tried numerous BB creams/tinted moisturizers with SPF, but the ones with higher SPF (25+ which is what I'd prefer for my face if I'm going to bother with this) don't typically have a texture or staying power that I really like. And I don't want to pile on makeup. Soooo....I read a lot of reviews and found this. I've been using it for about 3 weeks. Every. Day. It really is very light, absorbs very quickly and I have had NO break-out issues with it. No oiliness. It's actually quite good as a light moisturizer under whatever foundation or makeup I want to wear. When it was colder, I would still layer it with another moisturizer, but for the summer I will skip that step entirely and stick with the sunscreen.So in summary:I am mid-twenties, combination skin with mild hormone-related acne, light/medium skin.Product does not cause oiliness (even t-zone mid-day)No breakoutsWorks as light moisturizerNo white cast, absorbs quickly and fullyMy skin likes it and I highly recommend.

I was in love with this product because it was high SPF and it felt so light and not sunscreen-y, but Consumer Reports recently tested a bunch of sunscreen brands and EltaMD was one of the brands that did not live up to it's SPF claims. It was determined that EltaMD is actually less than SPF 30 (They weren't the only brand, I suggest looking up the full article). I had also given a bottle to my mom, who burns much easier than I do. When I told her about this article, she remarked that she thought she was burning too easily when she used it (compared to what she used previously), but she wasn't sure if she was imagining it or not. Now we know she wasn't... very disappointing.

ReviewTitle: it made my face break out in more acne
ReviewText: I wanted this to work, but after using it a few times I noticed I was breaking out more than usual. I have oily skin so I'm more prone to getting blackheads/whiteheads. This product made my face more oily and I got more blackheads/whiteheads along with painful pimples as well. I returned it right away after the second use. I wouldn't recommend this to any of my friends but I can see based on other reviews that it did work for other people. That was the main reason why I wanted to try it, but clearly it did not work out for me.

I loved this product until I realized it was causing my son and myself to develop hives.  The product is light and rubs in nicely.  There is no greasy feel, although, there is a slight chalky feel to it.  I love the dispenser because it is very easy to use.  I have never broken out in hives as far as I can remember, so I have no idea what is in this product that is causing the hives.  As long as you're not sensitive to this product, it is a great item.

ReviewTitle: No way I would buy again
ReviewText: I do not know where the high reviews come from. This moisturizer not only broke me out but it made my face drier. The more I put on to moisturizer it would only make my face whiter and whiter. I do not recommend at all.

ReviewTitle: Great sunscreen.  Light, high SPF, not oily, & niacinamide.
ReviewText: My favorite sunscreen that I have found so far.  It goes on clear, is light, high SPF, not oily, and it has niacinamide to help fade PIH.  It is a slightly more expensive for the amount you get, but it does work wonderfully.  It's a great physical sunscreen with Zinc Oxide vs the chemical options out there.  If you believe all sunscreens are equal you might want to check out the differences between physical and chemical sunscreens.  If you have a bad reaction to one it is worth trying the other type of sunscreen.  A downside that recently came up is that the dispenser has changed.  Before it used to work beautifully and a single pump would be enough to cover my entire face due to the air tightness of the bottle.  The new dispenser design allows air to get inside causing multiple pumps in order to get a proper portion.  But even with the flaw I still have to say it's one of the best sunscreens I have come across, I'd just wish they would revert back to the older dispenser design.
This product was not for me! I used it just twice and it made me breakout. If you guys have sensitive and acne prone skin and please avoid using this.
I like the EltaMD UVClear Board-Spectrum SPF 46,1.7 oz. I like theI like this product and use it every day.

This product clearly works well for the vast majority of those that purchase it but I was one of the few that had a terrible reaction.  This sunblock gave me the worst breakout I've had since high school.  My face looks like I was dragged behind a tank face first over gravel.  Hopefully this will not happen to you, but make sure you read the poor reviews so you know there is a chance this will happen to you as well.  I rarely get blemishes and I don't get break outs so this really caught me off guard.

I have been looking for a facial sunscreen for years that is not greasy, not thick, doesn't leave a white cast, doesn't make my face red, doesn't irritate -- in order words, a holy grail sunscreen. This has got to be one of the most hyped sunscreen creams in existence. It is listed everywhere as the holy grail sunscreen. Magazines, websites, blogs, videos, etc. I had not bought it because it was pricey. I finally bought it. It sucks. This sunscreen is no better than your typical mineral sunscreen at Walmart. It is thick (yuck), it is greasy (yuck), it makes your face look like you smeared it with Crisco. The only benefit that it does have is that it does not leave a white cast. But that's it. Horrible product. AVOID.

I really wanted to like this sunscreen! Everyone over at skincareaddiction seems to be crazy about this stuff. I have sensitive skin and it was relieving to know that this sunscreen did not irritate my face, and didn't have that sunscreen smell...However, I noticed something EXTREMELY annoying about this sunscreen. When I rub makeup primer on my face after applying this, or even skipping the primer and going straight to foundation, this sunscreen rolls into little white balls that are insanely irritating. I tried applying it, waiting 15 minutes, and then applying my primer... there were less balls, but there nonetheless. I've tried smoothing the primer on as gently as possible but even still the sunscreen just seems to love to ball up. I had to use a kabuki brush to gently wipe the balls off my face (heh) every time I used this. Eventually I gave up, and now I use Shiseido.

ReviewText: This product is okay, I bought it because it was highly rated. However, when I investigated the ingredients, there was an ingredient in here that is dubious and is thought to be toxic. I'm sorry, I don't have time right now to go back and check which ingredient it was. But just check the ingredients on here carefully before you order.

I've been using this sunscreen for more than 3 years. However, I just found out that this sunscreen contains an active ingredient called Octinoxate. I had to goggle what it is and this is what i found:"EWG recommends that consumers avoid sunscreens with oxybenzone. Octinoxate is an organic UV filter. It is readily absorbed into the skin and continues to be absorbed after the sunscreen has been applied. It has been found in blood 16 times above the proposed FDA safety threshold (Matta 2019, 2020)."Its also bad for the ocean and environment - Hwaii has banned this ingredient in their sunscreen products. I can't believe a long-trusty brand of mind would still use this in their product. I will stick with zinc oxide.

ReviewTitle: This sunscreen is harmful to your health -- Do not buy...
ReviewText: This product has octinoxate in it, an active ingredient that is known to mess with your hormones, and also those of animals, once it ends up in the ocean. On a hormonal level, it mimics estrogen and will mess with your thyroid, and is suspected to accumulate in people. It is harmful to you and to the environment and you really should not be applying this daily!In fact, some places, including the entire state of Hawaii, now have a ban on octinoxate (as well as oxybenzone) in sunscreen products because they had started to destroy the reefs. Just Google 'octinoxate' or 'Hawaii sunscreen ban' to find out more.A safe sunscreen for you and the environment is biodegradable, and ONLY has zinc or zinc and titanium as 'active ingredients' listed on the label. These naturally occurring minerals sit on top of your skin and aren’t absorbed into your bloodstream. When you swim in the ocean, these minerals simply fall back to the Earth from which they came.There are biodegradable sunscreens that DO NOT make your skin look white, and that can be applied on your face daily. It is quite sad that the Skin Cancer Foundation would recommend a product with a hormone disruptor in it. Sure, octinoxate has not been found to cause skin cancer, but it will mess with your health in other ways!! Maybe EltaMd is funding the Skin Cancer Foundation's cancer research?

ReviewTitle: Face too shiny. Makeup doesn't look good on top.
ReviewText: I had high hopes for this sunscreen, but I have been sorely disappointed with it. It protects well and it feels nice and moisturizing on the skin. However; it is just too shiny. If I put on moisturizer and then this sunscreen, my face is ridiculously shiny. Makeup doesn't look good over the top. The shine comes through, pores look really obvious, and my makes slides right off. If I skip the moisturizer, the effect is slightly better. But it's still too shiny and still looks bad with makeup. I don't understand the great reviews on this. It must just be a reaction with my particular skin. I'm using a normal 1/4 tsp amount of the product. I would say I have combo skin, with a little oiliness in the T-area but dry elsewhere. I would not repurchase this sunscreen.

ReviewTitle: Never break out and this broke me out so bad.
ReviewText: i had heard so many good reviews about the REAL product but this one is not good. I was so excited to use it on my face bc it was so light and it was so raved about. well after i used it the next day i was washing my face and my face felt all bumpy and i was breaking out all over my cheeks (mind you i never break out or have any sort of texturized bumps on my skin). I didn't want to believe that it was this product that had given me bumps and broken me out, but i tested it just to make sure before i put it on my face again. i put the lotion on a portion of my wrist and as you can see in the pictures i got the same reaction red little bumps all over my wrist, and not on the middle of my arm where i didn't apply the lotion. (it looks much worse in person the camera didn't capture it well.) If you are looking for something to calm redness or just a good face sunscreen i would not recommend this product. (

Remember even if it says “noncomedogenic”, “oil free” or “won’t clog your pores” on the bottle that doesn’t mean it’s safe to use on your skin. No government agency oversees this, so skincare companies can claim their products promote clear skin and still have pore-cloggers in their products. After submitting the ingredients of this product to on the acne clinic NYC website 3 pore clogging ingredients in this product were flagged 1. Isopropyl Palmitate, Coconut and Oleth-3. Do your research before purchasing.

Two pumps is enough to cover your face and neck front.  It spreads easily, but I’ve found it best to dot it around the face and neck, rub the rest into my palms, then disperse over the face and neck. If kept away from the lash line, it protects that delicate skin, too.  Not shiny, like so many others.  However, although I’m very light skinned, I add a couple of drops of Exuviance Sheer SPF 50 on top so it matches my skin tone better.  Rarely use foundation with this combination.  Another plus is that Elta MD dries quickly and isn’t tacky.  I’ve also used the tinted version of this sunscreen, which also works beautifully, though it may pill in more textured areas, like around the nose.  The last advice I can offer is, if you use moisturizer under this (and you should), make sure that the moisturizer is dry before applying the sunscreen. Highly recommended.

I'm a mid-50s gal who no longer wants to spend time fussing over the aging face. I mean, I'm clearly not in my 20s anymore.  But the old face isn't a complete disaster. Yet. That said, there are crow's feet and lip lines and smile lines and whatnot. So, yeah. Aging is happening. This sunscreen, however, is like a little secret weapon.  It provides sunscreen. Obviously.  A  little bit of color makes you look not dead which is a huge plus. But my favorite part is the dewy, glowy finish. I use this sunscreen on my face and an SPF chapstick and I don't know what it is.  Ya girl just looks a little fresher.  A little younger.  A little .... better.  Was worth the money for me. Would recommend. Good luck, ladies.

ReviewTitle: Warning- Spray Version Failed UVA Test
ReviewText: Consumer Reports did not test this lotion but they tested the similar spray and it was the worst performing sunscreen of all with  a score of 27. Trader Joe's Spray for $6 scored 100. If you want a fancy lotion, La Roche-Posay Anthelios 60 Melt-in Sunscreen Milk got the highest score of 100 for a lotion. The combination of zinc oxide and octinoxate may sound scientific but I would wait for independent testing of the lotion before considering this when the spray with the same active ingredients failed so miserably.  Just because lay people like the product, they have no idea how much protection they are  actually getting and skin cancer takes a long time to develop before you realize how screwed you are. Never rely on ordinary people to evaluate sunscreens, it is totally meaningless because they can't establish the long term impact of an inferior product.  The claims of dermatologist recommended if you notice they provide no names of actual dermatologists. I consider this product a scam.

ReviewTitle: Best sunscreen brand out there for men, too!
ReviewText: There’s a reason dermatologists suggest this brand. I’ve used the UV clear for years with no problems. It’s great for men with stubble too as it doesn’t pill up in your beard. Just have to rub into skin. I was a professional model and this was suggested by my dermatologist. never looked back works great no breakouts no irritation and protects your skin! Elta’s ‘shield version also great for oily skin. Just doesn’t have the niacinamide which the clear does. (Niacinamide calms skin and irritation) i’ve put this on after shaving and I’ve had no stinging with any of their sunscreens. Great products! It also comes in a tinted version which is very subtle. I have used that on shoots, and you would never know that I’m wearing it. I hate makeup and this gives me a natural glow to my skin. You can’t go wrong, guys...get this!

ReviewTitle: Not worth money in my opinion
ReviewText: I have actually bought this from the Dermstore not Amazon after seeing all the raves and recommendations for this product on the internet. I am shocked by how badly this stings around the eyes, not mentioning the piling that occurs when trying to layer it (had the same problem with Cerave AM). The main selling point to me was an inclusion of zinc and niacinamide since I have acne prone skin, plus of course the added benefit of potency mineral sunscreen. Will continue to use Japanese sunscreens that are far superior when it comes to comfort and wearability. It does not leave a cast so the "clear" claim holds at least.

It's hard to evaluate a product that's supposed to prevent something from happening, because you can't know what would have happened if you hadn't used it.I've used EltaMD sunscreens for many years and like them for several reasons.  I also dislike this one for an important reason.  Details below.BTW, I only buy things like this from my dermatologist.  He sells the real thing.  Too many reviews complain of counterfeit product, and while it's more expensive to buy it in person, it's worth it.PROS- I like the SPF 50.  Not a very common strength, unless you want the mass-market heavily fragranced stuff.- I love that it's unfragranced.  No smell at all.- Physical barriers work best but aren't as popular as the chemical ones because they show and can be harder to apply.  This one has zinc oxide.CONS- because of the zinc oxide, this goes on whitish and takes a bit of work to disappear.- It's a little thicker and stiffer than others, so it takes some rubbing for it to absorb and become invisible.  Rubbing is the one thing you DON'T want to do to your skin.For some strange reason, the product that comes out of the pump is thicker and harder to apply evenly than the stuff that comes out of the tube.  I prefer the tube - it's lighter and easier to apply.Overall, I like this product and will continue to use it.  But I'll buy it in the tube in the future.

I have used and loved Elta MD tinted spf 44 and thought this would be nice when I didn't want a tint. After a half hour walk, my face started to tingle and get red and I came home. It was early morning and winter so sun wasn't strong. I think there is something different in this one but I'm not sure what. I wont use it again but will continue to use the elta md tinted. I'm sorry I paid so much for it and can't use it but that scare was enough. It has been a few hours and is calming down but I wouldn't try it twice.

I bought this spf because I have dehydrated, oily, acne prone skin. I wanted a MINERAL spf that wasn’t going to irritate my acne and maybe even help it as well as not leaving a white cast because I am light skinned black. This spf did nothing for moisture, although I know it’s not technically supposed to, but it actually made my face feel dry and tight. It did nothing for my acne or hyperpigmentation. It has a terrible smell that I can’t even explain but it’s annoying because I could smell it coming off of my face literally all day long. It didn’t leave a horrible white cast after the first application but my face still looked a little ghostly and I didn’t dare reapply every 2 hours as I SHOULD because the cast only got worse. I really wanted a mineral spf to work but I just don’t think I’m going to find one that won’t give me a white cast and I refuse to spend a lot of money on one that I can’t even reapply, which is the whole point of even using it, without looking like Spongebob with the Suds.

ReviewTitle: I wanted to love this product because it's a physical SPF moisturizer with ...
ReviewText: First off, I originally got this product from a dermatologist so I am quite certain I did not get a fake.I wanted to love this product because it's a physical SPF moisturizer with niacinamide and vitamin E and it has an nice texture, but it just wasn't moisturizing enough for me. I use Differin at night which means that my skin needs more moisture and I really noticed my skin being drier and having flakes at the end of the day after switching from CeraVe's AM moisturizing lotion. This product does have a really great texture, but when I went on vacation to a drier climate, it tended to leave white powder on my face when it dried up later in the day. It can also leave white powder on your face if you put too much, like I tried to do because the product wasn't moisturizing enough for me.I will be sticking with CeraVe AM moisturizing lotion SPF 30 because it's a lot more hydrating and occlusive for my skin while still providing physical SPF and niacinamide (but no antioxidants). It's also a lot cheaper, which means that you will feel less guilty about using more and you will actually get the full amount of sun protection on the label. This is still a great product and will probably work well for people who are not using retinoids or do not have dry skin.[2019 update]Since I originally wrote this review I have tried this again. I rarely get acne anymore but if I use this sunscreen for just 3-4 days then my face will start to feel extremely tight and I will get huge painful cystic acne within a week. I know because it just happened. Also it seems like any kind of sunscreen that ends up pilling somehow compromises my moisture barrier and causes cystic acne for me, and this sunscreen very reliably pills (along with the new formulation of CeraVe AM after 2015). I now use La Roche Posay Anthelios SX and Mamonde Everyday Aqua Sun Cream, both of which I find to be very moisturizing and they have newer more innovative sunscreen ingredients than most of the products on the American market.
It is extremely important to take care of our face, so this suncreen really works. It makes skin smooth and clean of imperfection.

Despite using this product for several weeks without any issues, I had a serious reaction after using this on my face, neck & chest about 4 hours after applying. I used Claritin D to decrease the intense itching & hives which helped. Zinc oxide isn't the likely culprit but more likely the Octinoxate 7.5 mg that's responsible. 24 hours later, the itching & rash is still there. Saw my dermatologist who prescribed topical cortisone.

ReviewTitle: Best sunscreen for acne prone skin
ReviewText: I was going through a rough time with my skin was finding a routine and I came across this product on Tik Tok through a dermatologist.The purpose of this product is to protect the skin from the sun’s UV rays and helps those with acne-prone skin.Some of the main strengths of this product are it provides protection from the sun. Another strength would be the ingredients such as Niacinamide and certain ceramides that allow those with acne-prone skin to be able to wear sunscreen without having to worry about it clogging their pores.Some main weaknesses would be that it is only available online so when you run out you can’t go to the store and grab another one.Another main weakness would be it is a little pricey but not bad.One of the main weaknesses would be it does leave a bit of a white cast if not worked into the skin properly.Overall I give this product an A because I really like the product. It protects my skin from the sun without it congesting my pores. The white cast isn’t too much of a struggle I just have to work it into my skin a little more.

ReviewTitle: One of my favorite sunscreens ever!
ReviewText: This is one of the best sunscreens I’ve ever tried. Perfect if you have oily/combination skin, works well under makeup and barely leaves any white cast. This is moisturizing enough that I don’t need to use one in the mornings (I fo straight from Vitamin C to sunscreen and the makeup). The formula contains Niacinamide, Vitamin E and Hyaluronic Acid, providing additional benefits besides UVA/UVB sun protection. People with dry skin have reported the formula to be too drying, so it might be best for people with oily/combination skin.

I bought this from my dermatologist because they were running a special.  It's crazy expensive, which is the only reason I don't feel I can give it 5 stars, but it really is great stuff.  It doesn't feel heavy or greasy and it protects my skin pretty well for hours before I have to reapply.  I can even rub it straight onto my eyelids then sweat later or rub my eyes and it doesn't sting.  And since it's not greasy or goopy I am not hesitant to get it well into my ears, which is one of the places many people neglect and thus get skin cancers.  My daughter has pretty sensitive skin and breaks out very easily and this does not give her any trouble.

ReviewTitle: Made in China. Should say USA on it.
ReviewText: I was planning on buying this line of products based on great reviews from other sources. However, after seeing someone post there was no expiration date on their product I did some digging. These are coming from CHINA. The true product is made in the USA! According to the EltaMD site Amazon is an Authorized Retailer. You may have to do some digging on Amazon to buy the real deal!

ReviewTitle: This is the best sunscreen I've found
ReviewText: This sunscreen is whisper-light, fragrance free and moisturizing.  It absorbs quickly into the skin without leaving a tacky, sticky, oily or mask-like feeling and has no fragrance.  I don't even feel like I'm wearing anything on my skin.  I am 40 and have hormonal acne and melasma.  This product does not block my pores and it does a great job protecting my skin from additional sun damage.  In fact, my skin hasn't looked this good in years.  I'm rarely inspired to write a product review, but I think this one is worth it.

ReviewTitle: Not Mineral! Misleading label! Not for hyperpigmentation
ReviewText: Not mineral!! I have melasma, and sunscreen has octinoxate and octisalate. Too very bad ingredients for hyperpigmentation. Is misleading, and it doesn’t show ingredients on product pictures. If you want a chemical sunscreen there are plenty that are very good, my problem is this sunscreen sells on the premises of being mineral, and good mineral sunscreen are very hard to find. Not pleased.

This used to be my go to sunscreen. There is a hint of purple, cast on my dark skin, but worked in over time. I also wish that it was  100% chemical free. I have since moved on to a tinted fullychemical free brand and another great brand out of the UK, but this is a good runner up and decent for non-child bearing age lighter skin toned persons.

My old go-to was blue lizard but I noticed it was starting to really clog my pores.  I was leaving every surf sesh with a new pimple, how unfortunate.Purchased EltaMD from my DERM today, applied it all over my face for my 1 pm surf sesh and I’m not burnt at all!  Which is a surprise since this isn’t waterproof.  Also, my pores are squeaky clean.  Pretty easy to wash off with a good cleanser.  Whenever I used any other sunscreens (blue lizard, coola, sunbum, Neutrogena, shishedo to name a few) my face always feels very dry after I get out of the water and I need to apply lotion immediately.  But not this time after using EltaMD!  Face felt very moisturized the whole time.  It’s a little expensive but the quality has made me want to purchase their waterproof version as well for my longer surf sessions.If youre looking for a lightweight sunscreen that won’t cause acne this is definitely it (plus dries so nicely AND works as a greater primer for foundation)

ReviewTitle: ONLY spf that doesn't break me out! Great coverage.
ReviewText: Literally the only SPF that doesn't break me out. I have extremely sensitive, acne-prone skin, and I have tried dozens of sunscreens from drugstore to high end. Even the $40 high end SPFs broke me out, but NOT this one!!! It has a beautiful consistency, it's soothing and feels great to put on. I have *very* fair skin and I have not had even a slight burn with this spf; it's waterproof too (make sure to reapply though). I love that it is infused with niacinamide to help soothe redness.

The dematologist gave my husband the  UV Daily Broad Spectrum SPF 40  but he gave it to me after it irritated his skin. I thought that the irritation was due to him being a cancer pt. Therefore, I tried it since I do not have sensitive skin. Once it burned my skin I vowed never to use it again. ReviewTitle: Miracle! It does not break me out!
ReviewText: I have the most acne prone skin ever, and I tend to stay away from wearing sunscreen because sunscreens often break me out. But deep inside, I always knew I should be wearing sunscreen to protect my skin from UV rays. One day I ordered this on a whim and took a chance. So far so good! No signs of acne!It also wears AMAZINGLY well under foundation. It's better than some super high-end primers to be honest. I accidentally left this at my cousin's house when I visited for Thanksgiving. I bought another one. Sure it's not cheap, but it's so worth it. It's the only sunscreen I found that doesn't cause acne.

ReviewTitle: Beware: petroleum is a major ingredient
ReviewText: I have used this product consistently for about 8 weeks. Initially I loved it. Round about that time, without making the connection, I noticed that my foundation was separating after a few hours of wear. Bobbi Brown, Lancome, Tarte all had the same result. Then I noticed small pimples here and there. I wondered what was clogging my pores. I examined all my other skincare and it was fine. Until Elta. The second ingredient in this: petroleum. Yep, good old greasy Vaseline. I'm really disappointed in Elta. Without realizing it I've been wearing a product that won't let my skin breathe. Back to the drawing board.

Uses an airless pump, so I feel like I get to use all the product down to the last drop.I have acne prone skin and combination skin. Doesn’t leave me feeling greasy, gives my skin a nice healthy glow. Love the finish. Easy to spread. Will buy again and again. It’s pricey but every time I try something new I end up returning it. This doesn’t make me break out and looks lovely.

This sunblock is great!! Goes on very smooth and moisturizes my face and it also feels very light. It actually smooth out my wrinkle and works great with my acne prone skin.  Does not clog my pores.  Since it's oil-free it does not make my skin oilier.LH

1. Feels good on the skin, so unlike many other sunscreens this one works as a moisturizer for me.2. No whitish cast when you apply, or whitish bits. Goes on clear. Sinks in fast. I have a similar formulation from another manufacturer, but while that one goes on basically clear, it always leaves little white bits here and there. Not this one.3. Truly fragrance free, other than the mild smell of the ingredients which immediately goes away upon application.4. doesn't mess up my clothes if some gets on a shirt.5. Definitely seems to last the proper time in terms of sun protection.6. The texture of this is light, so doesn't feel or look greasy.I have tried many, many sunscreens at all price points. This is the best.What I would improve? I wish there was a smaller bottle I could travel with. Even though this fits TSA regs, the size of the bottle takes up more space than others of similar amount.

ReviewTitle: Wonderful product but I need more for the price.
ReviewText: I love love love this sunscreen! I am a tan, olive skinned person. On me, this leaves pretty much no white cast and if it does leave any, it absorbs within five minutes! It does not burn my eyes nor did it make my skin break out. For me, I’ve had no bad side effects with this product. I use sunscreen twice today; in the morning and in the afternoon when I leave work. There really is nothing bad for me to say about the sunscreen but I did deduct one star because there is not enough product for the price. I ran out of this sunscreen in a month or less. It’s a shame because as a person of color, it’s really hard to find a good sunscreen with zinc oxide. I don’t really know why they decided to only make this sunscreen in 1.7 ounces.  Anyway you get my point and this is otherwise a wonderful product.

Don't waste your money.  I've got terrible acne and even worse acne scaring.  I wore this for the first time today for a two hour bike ride and I look like a freaking raccoon.  My dark spots are 10X's darker than when I left.  It's like I rode w/ baby oil on my face.  I'm horrified and totally embarrassed.  How on earth am I supposed to go out looking like this?Not to mention, the smell.  GAWD, it smells like a dirty pet shop.  My husband even got close to me and said what is that awful dirty smell.I had such high hopes for this as nothing else is working for me and it got such good reviews.  Maybe people have different skin types than mine but for me, this is a total toss in the trash product.  Going back to my favorite Aveno daily moisturizer w/ SPF 15.

After applying this sunscreen my skin feels moisturized and protected. However, it also covers my natural summer glow with a white cast. The white cast does absorb a bit with time, but I'm self-conscious about it all day. I'm still on the search for a sunscreen with similar benefits, hold the white cast.

ReviewTitle: Small Amount for the High Price
ReviewText: When I first received this product I was beyond disappointed that I got such a small amount for the high price I paid. I felt like being cheated on. I understand that it has special ingredients and is specific to sensitive skin needs but c’mon at least 2-3 oz to make it feel satisfactory for the price I paid. The pump is also depressing because sometimes I will accidentally pump too much and a whole bunch of product will squirt on my hands and I’m forced to use more than I wanted.  But other than the sad size and poorly constructed pumping dispenser it has an amazing formula. When I first applied it I didn’t feel any stinging on my face and it dried to a nice matte finish. Throughout the whole day my face didn’t even feel greasy and it kept the oiliness at bay which is great because I usually have oily dehydrated skin. I can’t wait to see the effects it has on my acne prone skin with hyperpigmentation as it includes niacinamide and lactic acid both proven to help fade marks. When I’m done with this I think I will try the highly raved Biore sunscreen which is much cheaper and comparable.

Even though Its written on the product 'suitable for oily acne prone skin', it leaves a greasy film on the face and doesn't get absorbed even after an hour, and it caused irritation on active acne..I was hopeful about it after reading the reviews but just not suitable and definitely not worth the money..

ReviewTitle: My Skin Looks So Much Better
ReviewText: I asked my derm for a sunblock recommendation and purchased this from her office. I cannot live without this product now.I am somewhat acne-prone with uneven/blotchy and oily skin with dry patches. Not only has this product not broken me out, but my redness/blotchiness have been decreasing and my oily skin has become less oily. I've also received several compliments on my skin for the first time since I can remember. This product also seems to work as a great primer as my makeup stays in place much better than with expensive primers I have purchased. I recently purchased the PM Therapy and will post a review on that once I have given it enough time.Highly recommend!

In the beginning I liked this sunscreen a lot. It isn't fragrance free and smells a little bit medical if that make sense, but it isn't super offensive. It comes out of the bottle white and spreads out clear with no whitecast which I loved. The only negative is that over time I'm pretty sure it started to cause irritation -itching/burning around my eyes and on my neck. I ultimately switched to something else but I think it's a good option!

ReviewTitle: If you are a canary in a coal mine like me, then maybe get a sample of this ...
ReviewText: I am highly reactive to chemicals - to give you context for this review.  I have been looking for sunscreens that do not increase acne or rosacea, on top of my other reactions, so I tried this one. Something in this made me very nauseous to the point just before being sick to my stomach. Other sunscreens have had the same effect, so I will do a cross check to see what could be causing this.  If you are a canary in a coal mine like me, then maybe get a sample of this from your dermatologist to try before you invest in a full bottle.

The chemical octinoxate is right up there as a hormone disruptor.  Look it up!!  Go for pure titanium or zinc oxide.  Alba Botanica Mineral, or even Trader Joe's now carries 20% zinc oxide sunscreen.  If you want moisturizing, shea butter, or other oils are best, I think.
Too many toxic chemicals and hormone disrupter in this product.  Go to EWG.org for safe(r) sunscreens.

ReviewTitle: 25 with acne bc of this - Don’t do it!!
ReviewText: I bought mine at a medical office after I got a facial. I thought I had found what I needed to help my roscea but I couldn’t figure out why I had been breaking out HORRIBLY (I have redness bc of roscea not because of acne) since getting my facial. Now I know it’s because of this sunscreen!!! After another 3 pimples broke out on my chin and cheeks (I’m 25 and never had this bad acne) I stayed at home for a week and poof!!! My pimples were gone bc I didn’t use the sunscreen!I stopped wearing makeup for about a month now so I know it’s the sunscreen and not my makeup or moisturizer.

I take this all the way to my lashline and over my eyelids without irritation.  It does leave me a with a little bit of an amphibious sheen to my skin, slightly slick when I use a proper amount, but the ingredient list is a dream.  Elta MD UV Clear takes simplifies my morning routine with strong, broad-spectrum UV protection with stated 5% niacinamide.  I am so impressed I intend to try other products in this line like the Barrier Renewal Complex.  Quiet on claims while strong on delivery.
This stuff makes your face look like it’s coated in Polyurethane! 1000% Shiny Greasy Glow!. Yes it blocks the sun but your shine will bind everyone around you!

I’ve used super goop for sometime and it was just meh. Elta MD sunscreen gives me a matte/poreksss finish that I LOVE. The niacidnamide behaves well with my oily/acne prone skin. This sunscreen is the best.

The very best sunscreen! It goes on like a smoothing Gel consistency with very light pigment coverage but the spf 46 ++ gives lasting sun coverage- living in South Florida I need to have a light but effective sunscreen year round and this is by far the best feeling and best lasting sunscreen I’ve ever come across. I highly recommend this product, if you are on the fence don’t be just purchase you won’t be disappointed!

I love this stuff! I saw it on some morning show and thought I'd give it a try. I was looking for something with SPF that isn't gross white on your face, doesn't cause acne, and feels light but moisturizes. It ticks all those boxes. I've bought it 3x now. The 2nd package didn't seem to last as long as the first, but maybe I was just imagining that. I'll found out with the 3rd one, which I will be opening soon. Either way it's great for the price; I like to save over the department store versions I've bought in the past. They're also great, but 4X the price.

ReviewTitle: SEVERE RASH on a person who never breaks out!
ReviewText: Like many people this product caused a severe breakout/rash on my face which lasted for 3 days . No other product has ever given me this reaction and it happened twice!Many people seem to tolerate this product well but I would not recommend it ESPECIALLY if you have Rosacea even though its labeled and marketed for this condition. Too many people have had bad results with it (look at all of the negative reviews).I spoke with the company about the product and they denied it was the product that caused my rash. However, they did offer to replace it with body lotion.Would strongly deter you from trying this product!

Awesome sunscreen!Pros:- soaks in instantly and rubs in clear- doesn't sting my eyes- uses zinc oxide- fairly high SPF- unscented and alcohol-free- niacinamide is good for skinCons:- not 100% physical blockers- sometimes will sting the skin around my nose if it's raw from allergies- you can't see how much is left because of the airless pump, so you can abruptly run out- I don't want to use it with vitamin C serums because it also has niacinamide and they can react- sort of expensive

ReviewTitle: This is definitely an elegant formula for a sunscreen--it's easy to apply and doesn't leave a white cast (although ...
ReviewText: This is definitely an elegant formula for a sunscreen--it's easy to apply and doesn't leave a white cast (although I am very fair, darker skintones may have a different experience.) My only complaint is that it irritated my skin just a little bit on my chin, an area that's pretty sensitive for me, but still worth noting since I don't get that with other drugstore sunscreens. I have a hard time justifying this price considering it's not a very big bottle.

ReviewTitle: ... been suffering from rosacea and needed to find a good sunscreen for my face which has been having acne ...
ReviewText: I have been suffering from rosacea and needed to find a good sunscreen for my face which has been having acne rosacea. After numerous search, I decided to try this one with big hope. However, as soon as I put it on my face, there was burning sensation. Still, I kept it on to see if it was okay. After the whole day with this on, my rosacea got way worse! Stay away from this in case you have rosacea!! You won't be happy about it.

ReviewTitle: GREAT PRODUCT!! Not so great price..
ReviewText: I have yet to purchase this product, but was able to try it because PA at my dermatologist's office gave me a zillion samples. I was using Obagi's Nuderm spf 50 prior to this and was looking for a less expensive alternative. She told me it was $29 bucks, which is cheaper than the $45 for Obagi. I love, love, love this sunscreen. I like that it was for acne prone skin and supposedly calms it down. My skin isn't exactly irritated or inflamed, I just like how it sounds. It absorbs quickly, no funky sunscreen smell (think Neutrogena). It does NOT leave that white residue on your face. I usually apply my serum, then sunscreen, moisturizer and foundation last.Now on to the price.. The $29 was for 1.7 oz, whereas Obagi is $45 for 3 oz. Those are the prices they charge at the derm office of course, but even online the Obagi is cheaper. So back to Obagi I go. Shame, because I really grew to love this product. I find the products comparable though.

ReviewTitle: Can't use with other products, balls up
ReviewText: I was excited to find this at my local dermatologist's office, however after trying several times with varying combinations of products, I can't get this to work! Very disappointing. I have acne and acne scars, just started differin gel so sun protection is a priority. After applying this over every moisturizer I know and own, it balls or pills up leaving me with white fluff all over my face! Not cute when your trying to apply makeup after to cover up acne/scarring! The only good quality is that is does feel nice going on, before it pills. Leaves me wondering if my skin is protected because it's coming off after application. Had potential but unfortunately not for me

ReviewTitle: No chemicals, perfumes, high quality and $15 cheaper than at dermatologist's office
ReviewText: $45 at dermatologist. He said it was the best. No chemicals, no perfumes, no garbage, just protection. This bottle is small, but this is for face, and it lasted me nearly a year. This is worth it!! I live in Houston, TX, and the dermatologist said that everyone living in a climate like this should basically be using a high SPF sunscreen every day. This goes on smooth and dries quickly. No cons I can think of, except that it's not cheap, but $30 a year? Not too bad, especially for daily use.

ReviewTitle: CAUSED CYSTIC BREAKOUT ALL OVER FACE
ReviewText: This caused the WORST acne breakout I have ever had from a product.  I only used it for two days and woke with huge painful cysts all over my face.  I have clear skin and don't struggle with acne.  I stopped usage and the painful bumps just keep coming several days later.  My previously smooth forehead is covered in clogged pores and bumps.  Its horrendous!  I am now highly suspicious as to whether all the positive review are genuine or paid for.  Beware and definitely patch test.

This sunscreen is the very best for oily, acne prone skin.  I have tried so many sunscreens over the past few years but never stuck with them because they all caused my oily skin to look and feel oiler and all seemed to emphasize my large pores and make them appear even larger.  When I went to a dermatologist for pigmentation issues she told me I MUST use a sunscreen and recommended this one when I told her of my issues.  She said I would LOVE this one and she was absolutely right!  I don't go a day without sunscreen now thanks to this product.  Also, I have found my adult cystic acne has virtually disappeared since using this sunscreen.  I have used proactiv solution and other systems for years and have been treated by a dermatologist for acne, but it has never completely gone away until using this sunscreen. I am very particular about everything I put on my face and I highly recommend this product.

ReviewTitle: The best sunscreen for non-sensitive and dry skin type.
ReviewText: I bought Elta MD 40 SPF before, and I wanted to have higher protection. I love the brand and ingredients. I'll keep ordering it. I can't leave home without wearing sunscreen never ever.  I have dry skin and not sensitive at all. and I'm 30 years old, no wrinkles so far.

ReviewTitle: I also use the Elta MD AM moisturizer underneath the sunscreen which is a great combo. Overall
ReviewText: The reviews were right! I was introduced to this by one of my skin-care friends, and I must say I am very impressed. A little goes a long way, no white residue (unless you over-apply, but again a lot goes a long way!), and very thin on the skin.Also very acne-prone friendly, and I even feel a difference in the way my skin looks and feels.I also use the Elta MD AM moisturizer underneath the sunscreen which is a great combo.Overall, impressed! And will definitely purchase again.

I love this sunscreen. I had been buying it from my dermatologist. I’m thrilled to find out I can get it from Amazon. It does not break my face out. In fact, my skin looks much better since using this.

ReviewTitle: Great sunblock but it is greasy.
ReviewText: This is a nice product but I was looking for something drier.  I can't wear before snorkeling or diving because it is slippery and my mask slides around and leaks.  And then it gets in my eyes while diving and I can't get it out.  This product is ok for land if you don't mind a little bit greasy.  I found the Australian Gold mineral based sunscreen is dry and works great while diving and snorkeling.

Works great for sensitive skin, and is nice and light, but  hard to tell if you're getting much protection. I wear it faithfully every time I go out, but am getting sunspots and sun as if I'm not wearing anything. This is on days without sweating. On summer days, it sweats right off. Do you reapply ever few minutes?? If you wear make up over it, that makes it even trickier to reapply often. Using Retin A creams, sunscreen is a must, so this is an issue. Also, it is very pricey.

ReviewTitle: Great product with a company that does not stand behind it
ReviewText: I have been using this product for many years with excellent results.  I have had an issue with the pump mechanism in the last 2 products purchased and reached out to the company directly.  The company response was  its not our problem it is the re-sellers' problem.  Great product but the company does not stand behind it.

ReviewTitle: Great sunscreen that also has moisturizer
ReviewText: I have been using this product for about a year and find it one of the better sunscreens...plus it is tinted. I like that it is moisturizing as well as sun screen. I decided to buy from Amazon this summer for trip to Grand Canyon where sunscreen is a must. I bought tube in July 2015  and was surprised to find expiration date 8/12.. Not sure if this has been giving me protection or not....hoping it has because I recently noticed expiration date.
Feels like you have nothing on, no stinging, stickiness or chalkiness. This is something I can get my 20 something dtr to use every day. Very nice product.

Received this product for review. I was surprised at the cost when I looked it up but after speaking to my aunt who is a dermatologist and she recommended this cream. It is very light and not greasy, so far seems to be working great.
I did not like this at all - my skin is super sensitive and this broke me out. Leaves white streaks and made my flaky skin stand out SO bad. Do not recommend

ReviewTitle: 1.7 oz for $36 and the don't even display the ingredients? I DON'T THINK SO
ReviewText: 1.7 oz for $36 and the don't even display the ingredients? I DON'T THINK SO

I received some samples from a dermatology office - put one packet all over my face, arms and legs one day while sitting out in full sun for over 2 hours - I got no color at all!  The best thing is that is glides on well and absorbs well without feeling heavy or chalky as zinc oxide can.  I like the sample packs - there's a surprisingly good amount of product in there and I can easily carry a couple with me all the time.  I would recommend this over Blue Lizard - it is much heavier white cream with lower SPF (30+) coverage.  The Elta is more like makeup consistency and even though I use the tinted, I don't notice any color when it's applied.
This product is causing me to breakout. I have sensitive acne prone skin. I though this would help me, however it’s just leading to breakouts that are quite cystic. I’m giving this away.

I haven't bought this yet from Amazon. I'm close to 40 years old and periodically get acne. For the 1st time ever, 4 months ago, I saw a dermatologist. She set me up with several samples, one of which was this. It's the only sunscreen I'll ever use on my face again. I haven't had skin problems in 3 1/2 months and this product protects and doesn't irritate or clog pores. I wish it wee less expensive.

I rarely wear makeup, but I wear this lotion every day.  The instant I ran out this morning, I walked to the computer and ordered a new bottle.  One bottle lasts quite some time.  This lotion doesn't run into my eyes and burn when I sweat while running.I find that elta md brightens my skin when I apply it, making me look refreshed.  Typically, daily use of elta md will single-handedly keep my skin from drying out.I do have a thyroid condition that occasionally makes my skin doubly dry and tight.  When that happens, a tiny bead of Cera Ve p.m. mixed with elta md whips my moisture balance back into shape.This lotion is also awesome under foundation, for those rare occasions when I wear it.

ReviewTitle: Best solution for adult problem skin
ReviewText: I tried many sunscreens but this one is definitely the best one yet. I have a sensitive skin that breaks out for any reason any time, and every sunscreen I tried caused at least a couple of breakouts around my chin area. This one looks like it's creamy but goes on light and offers a great protection from the sun. When you apply it just allow it a couple of minutes to soak in and then continue with your make up routine. I will never stop using this and I hope they never stop making it.

I have been looking for a facial sunscreen that wouldn't make me break out and irritate my rosacea. It isn't as oily as alot of other sunscreens I've tried. The tint is very very light. I don't even notice it on my skin.

My dermatologist recommended this product because I refused to wear heavy SPF on a daily basis under my make-up.  This product is incredibly light -- it does not have any of the icky, thick, greasy feeling of every other sunscreen out there -- plus it works.  I use it absolutely every day -- even if I'm indoors -- just out of habit.  It is very reasonably priced for something this high quality.
It is only ‘Mineral-based’ still has too many questionable chemical ingredients. 100% mineral sunscreens are safer for you and safer for the oceans.

Since it's summer, the first thing that comes to mind is wearing sunscreen. Being a girl with super oily skin, most of the sunscreens I've used tend to be a bit gunky, too thick of a formula that it ends up leaving a film over my skin and creating even more oil buildup throughout my day (and welcoming some unwanted acne!). Well, not anymore! Since I started working at Skin Thera P Medical Spa in NYC, my eyes have been opened to the beauty that is the UV Clear. This formula is so lightweight, AND it's oil-free! What I love about Elta MD in general is the fact that they have a product for every skin type; it moisturizes the skin as well as protecting it from harsh sun rays. What's also a plus about the Clear is that niacinamide in the formula helps calm and protect sensitive skin, which is a big plus to those who are acne prone. I can definitely see and feel and improvement in my skin, and I love it! I would definitely recommend, and repurchase!

ReviewTitle: Never BUY this, it should be taken down!
ReviewText: I used this product and got severe itching in my neck and forehead area non stop for 2 days ! This product is definitely is not for normal skin (forget sensitive skin). Either this cream is a fake or something in it causes severe reactions ! Amazon should remove this ASAP !

ReviewTitle: Not good for those with dry skin
ReviewText: My dermatologist recommend I try this. I have very dry skin and when I applied this my face was still dry. Therefore, it's not good for someone with my skin type. It also had that chalky, uncomfortable texture that again is not good if you have dry skin.

ReviewTitle: This product contains the toxin octinoxate as one of the active ingredients!
ReviewText: Octinoxate has been removed from the FDA Safe and Effective list for a good reason. It reacts in sunlight to produce free radicals which are carcinogenic. I am surprised that  Amazon represents this product as a game changer. Just more poison!
Please, please stop putting hyaluronic acid in your sunscreen. I live in a dry climate and all this does is dry the heck out of my skin. Spreadability is okay, it does pill though.

ReviewTitle: actually works for acne prone skin!!!!
ReviewText: This is amazing daily sunscreen!! I have struggled to find an spf that didn't make me break out. Even the ones that were marketed for acne prone skin made me break out but I haven't had one issue with this stuff!!! Originally got it from my dermatologist but i will be buying again from amazon as it is cheaper here.

ReviewTitle: Finally, a sunscreen that doesn't make me feel greasy.
ReviewText: I live in a tropical climate and require a sunscreen in my daily beauty routine because I think my moisturizer and foundation do not have a high enough SPF.  I am fair complected and a bit of a product junkie-and over the years I have tried a fair amount of products.  What I like about this is that it goes on in a thin layer, doesn't aggravate my skin and although I sweat on a daily basis, it doesn't feel like that typical greasy layer that you get from typical sunscreens.  I use this in conjunction with the SPF 30 body lotion (for chest and arms) in my daily routine and get great results without being greasy.  Makeup applies beautifully over this sunscreen must have. Finally, a sunscreen that doesn't make me feel greasy.

ReviewTitle: Finally! An SPF Product worth reviewing...
ReviewText: I am an avid online shopper on all the sites and I rely heavily on reviews, yet I never have left one myself until now.  I am in my 30's, fair complexion and somewhat dry-ish skin.  I have been buying SPF products FOR YEARS looking for something I can put on my face that blends easily so I can put make up on afterwards, something that doesn't have fragrance (I'm super sensitive to fragrance) and something that doesn't leave a white, ghostly hue all over my skin or pill up after rubbing.  I have purchased it ALL.  My favorite in the last year or so has been La Roche Posay Extreme Fluid SPF 50, which is very good compared to the millions of other products out there.  But it has a slight fragrance and it does leave a slight white hue on my face and I have to wait forever for it to blend into my skin (and probably wear off) before applying make up, so I often go without it - which is bad for my fair skin and I live in Los Angeles where the sun is hot and always shining.I decided to try yet another SPF product and ordered Elta MD because a few years ago I used an SPF tinted moisturizer from this line that I liked very much until I discovered Laura Mercier's line (which I LOVE). I remembered Elta MD being really nice on the skin, effective and fragrance free. So I ordered this Elta MD Clear SPF and I'M SO GLAD I DID!!!!  It's my favorite!  It isn't greasy, it is indeed CLEAR as you apply it to your face (even though it comes out of the bottle white), it's fragrance free and it blends into my skin like a normal moisturizer.  I hope Elta MD NEVER stops producing this product.  It is everything I have needed.  Somebody FINALLY got it right!  Seriously, buy this because the more people know about it, the longer it stays on the shelves.

ReviewTitle: This is my everyday go to
ReviewText: I have used this product for over a year. I apply it almost everyday and love it. Its definitely essential. The only somewhat negative thing I have to say is this: it can leave and or make your face look a bit lighter. Its partially a spf product, so realistically this is to be expected. Nevertheless, I love it. It goes on smooth and doesn't have a strong smell.
Somewhat pointless.  The tint is so sheer it barely covers blemishes. Very watery
Amaizing sunscreen for rosacea.

I have dry, rosacea skin that is very sensitive. Chemical sunscreens make me break out and my eyes to water. This is the PERFECT sunscreen with great SPF. I heard other people say it pills, but that hasn't happened to me at all.

ReviewTitle: Irritation and burning sensation when product was applied
ReviewText: I have Rosacea and my dermatologist recommended this product. I have recently moved to US and rosacea was badly flared up due to the more UV here.When I applied this sunscreen, my skin was completely irritated. It took me 3 days to realise that it's this sunscreen that have made my rosacea worse.. and not the exposure to sun. I discontinued and it took 3-4 days for my skin to calm down.So while it suits many, it might not suit some people with hyper sensitive skin. Test it first to see if your skin accepts it.

ReviewTitle: Best Sunscreen for Sensitive Skin I’ve Ever Found
ReviewText: Absorbs quickly, no white residue, excellent protection, and absolutely no irritation to my acne-prone skin. I just bought my second bottle. Recommended by my dermatologist!

I really did my homework before buying this lotion and am completely satisfied. I have sensitive skin and it does not irritate my skin. I love that I can put it around my eye area and it does not start to burn (other lotions have since it has SPF). The pump works great and doesn't get clogged. Absorbed great on your skin without white marks.

ReviewTitle: Tried many, sticking with one - this one.
ReviewText: I have worn at least SPF15 every single day since it became available in moisturizers some 20 years ago. I've tried many MANY brands including high end and drugstore brands, finally settling on Clinique's Super City Block SPF40 which I have used for some 2-3 years now. I came across Elta UV Clear SPF46 at my dermatologist's office after a SkinMedica Vitalize peel and LOVED it. It was also the sunscreen of choice at another dermatologist's office after a BBL laser treatment.It is non-greasy, fragrance free and sinks invisibly into the skin. I am prone to blemishes but this seems to have no adverse effects on my skin at all; it's like you're not wearing anything at all.I HIGHLY recommend this sunscreen.
The manufacturer should reposition this product as being an exfoliator instead of being a sunscreen.  It caused my skin to peel repeatedly.
I have very sensitive skin and this product did not seem to break me out at all, however it does leave a white film and is very sticky.

ReviewTitle: Feels like regular moisturizer and not like sunscreen at all
ReviewText: Feels like regular moisturizer and not like sunscreen at all. Not greasy and doesn't clog my pores. I wear it on my face 365 days/year. Was recommended by my dermatologist. I have combo skin and 50 years old, and will only use this brand of sunscreen on my face. Highly recommend.

ReviewTitle: BEST STUFF EVER for sensitve skin
ReviewText: My dermatologist not only recommended this to me due to my ultra sensitive skin but gave me a bunch of samples to try it out, I have since bought it cause it has worked out SO well for me. And seeing I have very sensitive skin thanks to rosacea that is sun light sensitive and prone to breakouts this product is a god send. I no longer break out and my skin is no longer irritated due to my sunscreen and I cannot tell you what a relief that is. I would recommend this to anyone as really it's the best sunscreen around. I was able to not only be out in the sun all day and NOT get a burn but my skin didn't break out or was red and irriated for days after using it either. Finally I have a sunscreen I can use daily and not have to worry about my sensitive skin getting irritated.

ReviewTitle: The Absolute Best Facial Sunscreen There Is IMO
ReviewText: I decided I wanted to start taking better care of my skin by using sun screen on a regular basis. So, I went on EWG's website to find a recommended facial sunscreen and found this to have a rating of 2 which made me really excited since Amazons reviews were almost all positive. I will say the price has gone up quite a bit since I started purchasing this about 9 months ago, but I just buy it where I can get it the cheapest (about $22 per bottle). There isn't a thing that I don't love about this product. It is paraben free, light weight but very moisturizing, does not leave my skin ashy looking despite having zinc in the ingredients, and comes in the best packaging for a face cream which is a pump style bottle that cannot be opened to allow air inside. My skin is fair and my cheeks burn fairly easily in the sun, but I have never had a problem since using this even on the sunniest days. I really appreciate the high level of niacinamide since I truly believe it's an ingredient which has improved my skin. My cheeks used to be very pink and they have calmed down dramatically in the last 6 months. What I will say is good to know based on my experience is that it may be hard to tell when you're running low because the bottle is already light weight, so after about 6 weeks of daily use, it would be about time for another bottle. Also, I have not had any allergic reaction to any of the ingredients in this cream but some other people have said they have. Unfortunately I can't comment on that since it hasn't happened to me. Overall, this sunscreen has become my absolute favorite skin care product of anything I own by far and I highly recommend it :)

ReviewTitle: Caused me to break out in hives
ReviewText: I started using this product about a month ago while it was still winter.  It did not irritate my skin at first, but I have taken into consideration that it was still winter and the sun was not as strong and it was usually partly-cloudy where I live.  Now that it is spring and the sun is out more, I have been applying the product more, but it seems as soon as the sun hits my face and reacts with the sunscreen, I break out in hives.  It's really shocking because I normally have perfect skin and then I use the sunscreen and wake up the next morning with little red bumps all over my face that look like the chicken pox or something. Not cute at all!  I researched allergies to sunscreen and it turns out I have a photoallergy to the sunscreen, which is when there is a reaction between the chemicals in the sunscreen and the sunlight.  I'm really sad that this product has turned out to be a bust because at first I thought it was really great.  It seems to work for some people, but I have really sensitive skin so I would recommend for anyone else who has already clear but sensitive skin to not use this product.

ReviewTitle: Will help protect us from harmful rays
ReviewText: I LOVE this sunscreen. I take really good care of my skin, and I know that harsh sun rays can be extremely damaging. I dont muck around with low end brands that leave nasty residues all over my skin. This sunscreen is just so light on my skin, I love it. I use this in conjunction with my daily routine:

First off, the best thing about this product and the company EltaMD is that they are PETA approved which means they are 100% cruelty free. Amazingly this product is vegan as well.Besides being animal friendly, this sunscreen is awesome! It's consistency is light and it soaks into the skin. My skin is very prone to severe cystic acne and so far this has not broken me out. I am SO sick of companies thinking that if you are looking for an oil free non pore clogging product that they have to put salicylic acid or benzoyl peroxide in them which makes acne worse. Luckily EltaMD has made this perfect product not loaded with chemicals and skin drying crap! An added bonus is that the niacinamide in this product not only helps calm acne prone skin. but it helps with aging. This product is awesome for those of us that have adult acne and are looking for something that won't break us out, dry us out and will have anti-aging benefits.This is the best sunscreen as well as moisturizer that I have ever used! It's oil free, fragrance free and not tinted (thank goodness!).

I love the sun and have been tanning for years. Tanning can take a toll on your face, so if you do tan your face, use a sunscreen like Eltamd UV Clear, it blocks the sun’s harmful rays and is light and clean on your face. Also, use a good moisturizer. I use Skingenixx Super Hydrating Moisturizer

After reading all the previous previews, I wanted to leave my experience. The packaging cake well sealed. I have purchased EltaMD products before from my dermatologist so I’m familiar with the packaging. My order came in and as you can see from the pictures it is well sealed. The batch number from the box is the same batch number in the bottle. Today is my first day using this specific product so I will come back and give an update on my review. I order the non-tinted version since I was worried about it being to thick and clogging my pours. I’m excited to use this. I have rosacea and hormonal acne.

Either this bottle missed quality control or the it is counterfeit. Granted, I bought it last year (2016) as a backup, and it has been sitting and waiting its turn for a while. However, it isn't yet expired, and it was kept in a pretty cool, dark, and dry cabinet. Yet when I used the cream for the first time last week, both the smell and the color were off -- completely unlike the (many) other bottles of this product I have used. I guess I'll have to go back to the dermatologist to get the real stuff. Very disappointed.

I would have this product buried with me. I SWEAR by this and Elta Daily.I have dry skin that likes to peel if I’m not on my moisturizer game while living in the desert. On days I’m really dry I use UV Daily. On days when I have a pimple or feel my skin is congested, I use this UV Clear.If you’re trying to decide which you want, UV Daily is a MOISTURE BOMB. Not thick and gross, but definitely creamy.UV Clear moisturizes, but I find it soaks in and leaves a semi-matte finish. Sometimes I layer a different cream over it if I want the skin clearing benefits, but an added emollient.I recommend this HIGHLY to anyone who can’t find a sunscreen that doesn’t break them out. It never seems to leave a white cast (though I am quite pale) and it’s certainly never CAUSED a zit.

Absolutely love it.I have melasma and every single morning after I brush my teeth I need to cover my face with sunscreen. This product is the only one (of the thousand different sunscreens I have tried) that actually doesn’t make my skin to break out, doesn’t give me oily look and I can see the protection (my sun spots are remaining the same)! I like the product so much that I ordered and the tinted version (which I didn’t like and don’t recommend), as well as the Face cleanser and eye cream. Well, Elta’s superstar is definitely this sunscreen. It’s my absolute favorite product so far and I don’t intend to switch or even try anything else in the foreseeable future!

Best feeling sunscreen I've tried in USA.  I know sunscreens made in Korea are light years ahead when it comes to applying and wearing comfort.  I don't have Korean sunscreens.  I live in FL and I needed good ones very badly for my family and myself.  A visiting relative told me about this one (she's a dermatologist).  I ordered and got it the same day.  This is it.  It's pricey BUT kids don't mind wearing it!  It goes on like a moisturizer.  It feels like a light moisturizer!  I love it.  I tend to break out.  I used generously couple times already and no breakout.  And sun protection works great- I tested while kayaking.  I highly recommend it.

I can’t say how well this moisturizes since I only tried a dab of it on each cheek. First thing I noticed was the smell. I thought it was fragrance free. Second thing I noticed was it burns. It is very thin liquid with a subtle yellow tint. It does go on sheer if you only use a dab which is what I did however I don’t know how this can be for sensitive skin since it burns when applied but I have very sensitive skin and most things that work for other people don’t work for me. I have my best luck with Clinique and never any issues. I think this has to many chemicals for my sensitive skin and I need a physical sunscreen only. I’m not a fan of the smell either and this is the only one labeled fragrance free that actually has a scent that I’ve tried so far.

I like that this has niacinamide in it, which is great if you have oily skin, or anyone really! It does feel lightweight, and although there is a slight white cast at first (I’m medium skin toned) it goes away after a few minutes, and doesn’t leave a greasy feel/look. Also love that this is in a pump! Only down side is the price for how little this is, especially if you use every 2 hours. I happen to work outside quite a bit so I do. Lost 1 star because I wish it were a higher SPF. I’ll be looking for something more affordable.

ReviewTitle: Has been my #1 sunscreen for 5 years, don’t plan to stop
ReviewText: As background, I have had severe acne for years and this sunscreen has done wonders. Even while I was taking Accutane, it was the perfect sunscreen. Since I’ve been off it, I’ve used tretinoin and it’s been equally if not more helpful. It helps combat redness and sensitivity and makes my skin feel sort of insulated, like a face oil on top of a moisturizer. It also helps heal recent flare-ups. I have less hyperpigmentation after a zit than I did before using this sunscreen. In terms of appearance, I have pink-tinted, fair to medium skin tone - not tan, not pale. It doesn’t leave any white cast, but it can increase shine a fair amount. So, if that’s not ideal, I might stay away. I personally don’t mind it and it’s more on the side of dewy than wet. I think it’s a magical sunscreen, the only downside is price in my opinion. I do choose to splurge on this, but it’s definitely not worth it for everyone.

This SPF is amazing!!! I have tried so many sunscreens and decided to try this after many positive reviews.  This one has everything I wanted. It is a mineral based small (pricey) pump bottle and it dispenses like a lotion, not watery. It blends in very well with a great finish and does not feel hot or make my face feel like it has a glove on. It is oil and fragrance free.**I read somewhere that this formula is NOT water resistant so FYI you will need another face sunscreen if you go swimming. It is also not completely chemical free and contains 7.5% octinoxate, a UVB filter. Overall I feel this is worth the money if you want a suncreen for your face and neck that works well and will not make your face feel hot.

I have sensitive skin that’s prone to breakouts if anything new is applied and this product didn’t make my face break out. It’s light, nearly scent-free, and absorbs easily without residue. Works well under makeup.

ReviewTitle: Just what I was looking for
ReviewText: I wanted a higher spf sunscreen to wear daily and under my makeup that wouldn’t leave a greasy feel or smell horrible. It was a tall order. This met all my requirements. It doesn’t have the sunscreen smell, is thin enough that it blends well, and doesn’t leave a greasy feel. I’ve mixed it with my day cream but also worn it alone and it’s been great both ways. I’m very pale so I can’t say if it will leave a white cast or not though. Highly recommend.

ReviewTitle: Works great on acne prone skin/skin with rosacea
ReviewText: Both my daughters and I love this sunscreen.  I have rosacea and they have typical acne prone teenage skin and this does not inflame or aggravate either condition.  Works really well too at preventing sunburns.  Goes on smoothly and does not leave a chalky whiteness that so many other zinc based formulas do.  Recommended by my dermatologist, I'm happy to have found this.

After doing a lot of research for sunscreen I came across this product about a year ago. Doesn’t leave your skin feeling oily and doesn’t run down your eyes when you’re working out. Even in the high elevations it protects your skin. I use it every day at work and when I’m doing Exercising or doing outdoor activities.

ReviewTitle: Comedogenic! Does NOT play well with makeup
ReviewText: Terrible! I have never had so many blackheads and breakouts as I now have after just 3 uses of this product! Does NOT play well with makeup and I've tried servaral different product lines that do fine with other sunscreens. I could not get this to behave and hot just make a mess on my face. Gross. Just skip it and go for La-Roche Posay.

I have Uber sensitive skin and I am afraid to try any new products. My friend's boyfriend suggested me this and upon reading the reviews, I got mixed reviews but thought of giving it a shot. I really loved the product and it set well with my skin. I did not experience any breakout and the SPF is really good for everyday use. I have seen considerable results and it has definitely helped with reducing tan. I would however recommend to do a patch test on face and see if the product really goes well with you.

Great buy. This was recommended by my African American dermatologist. Best for my oily skin. Goes on smooth, not oily at all. It even helps the dark spots. Feels good on my skin. Also last all day without getting oily.

ReviewTitle: Almost feels like I'm wearing nothing
ReviewText: This sunscreen is great! I have kind of oily face and acne-prone skin, so I hate sunscreen lotions because they are greasy and sticky. Even the ones that advertise being non-greasy or "invisible" like Cetaphil and Neutrogena Ultra Sheer. This sunscreen is actually invisible and applies on the skin so smoothly. After application the skin absorbs it well and the face is matte. Even though Elta MD has a nice misty/matte finish, my skin still feels moisturized. I am glad I made the switch to Elta MD.The only thing is that the sunscreen is "fragrance-free" but I still smell a bit of a chemically odor, but that's because I have gotten used to wearing it daily.

ReviewTitle: Great for sensitive & acne prone skin
ReviewText: Found this sunscreen after months of research & I can confirm, with my sensitive & acne prone skin, this product gets the job done and no break outs! It’s glorious! There is less than a handful of sunscreens on the maker that do not break me out, this is one of them. Glad I found this, I’m on my second bottle.

It's no wonder why dermatologists swear by this product! It's silky smooth, and does not leave a white cast. It feels like a very expensive moisturizer, and leaves your face well moisturized by sinking in and not sitting on top. This sunscreen is going to be my everything, morning and nigh-time moisturizer, it's that good. I'll put on all of my serums and layer this sunscreen on top. Best one I've tried, and I've tried them all. Even if your skin is oily, this works with no additional greasiness, just buy it.

Does not burn...try to put it on atleast 15 minutes before going outside. And hopefully your face is mostly dry to dry when you apply.... it still seems to work very well if you are slightly sweaty but not drenched. No harsh smell to lotion and I have used this for many years and I don’t burn ...now that said...I’m in Florida and I do reapply if I’m out for a while and have been wiping the sweat from my face :)

My far the best sunscreen I have ever used.  I have rosacea and had no issues with this causing more redness, burning, or stinging.  It didn't burn my eyes and I was able to apply it to my eyelid and under eye area.  It has no white cast and adsorbs quickly without leaving a greasy feeling on the skin.  The only downside is the price but I think it's a you pay for what you get situation.

I LOVE this sunscreen. I have normal/oily, melanated, acne prone skin and not once has this broken me out. I love how lightweight it is. When the formula says clear, baby they mean it! It doesn’t cast a white film-like layer on my ski, so no more pale dead zombie face for me! The packaging is also easy to use, the pump hasn’t gotten jammed even though I use 2-3x a day. Drop the pennies and just buy it!

I haven’t noticed the ‘’matte finish” that they advertise tho. my face doesn’t look oily at the end of the day per se, but definitely not matte:)

I stop using my mosturizer during the day because Im only applying the ELTA sunscreen but my face still looks really oily. I already have acne problems, it doesn't seems like it clogged my pores but I have a shinny face with this product.
